0.title: Snake enters field during India-South Africa T20I in Guwahati, video goes viral
0.article_body: The play during the second India-South Africa T20I in Guwahati was briefly halted after a snake entered the field. The snake was spotted after India's seventh over. Several groundsmen came on the field and escorted the snake away from the playing area after which the game resumed. "Never saw a snake stopping a cricket match," a fan tweeted.

1.title: If Ind's WC campaign is centred on winning toss, it's big worry: Chopra
1.article_body: Former cricketer Aakash Chopra said that it's a big worry if India's entire T20 World Cup campaign is centred on winning the toss. "They (India) failed to defend against Pakistan and Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup," Chopra said. He added, "But if they keep fielding first, they might suffer when the toss doesn't go their way."

2.title: Pic shows the car ex-PM Lal Bahadur Shastri bought after taking a ₹5,000 loan
2.article_body: Former PM Lal Bahadur Shastri's grandson Vibhakar Shastri took to Twitter to share a picture of the car that belonged to the former PM. "Shastri Ji took a loan of ₹5,000 from the bank to buy this car...After his death, the loan was repaid by Smt. Lalita Shastri," he tweeted. Sunday marked the 118th birth anniversary of the former PM.

3.title: ONDC floats consultation paper for public to comment on 24 issues
3.article_body: The Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC) has floated a consultation paper to seek comments of the public on 24 issues relating to payments, fulfilment of orders, refunds and cancellations. ONDC is hoping to democratise the e-commerce segment in India and is seeking to build trust among the participants. The ONDC called it an "open consultation".

4.title: Airox Technologies aims to raise ₹750 cr IPO, files papers with SEBI
4.article_body: Medical oxygen supplier Airox Technologies has filed its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with SEBI to raise ₹750 crore via an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO will entirely be an offer-for-sale (OFS) by shareholders Sanjay Bharatkumar Jaiswal and Ashima Sanjay Jaiswal. Sanjay and Ashima intend to sell shares worth ₹525 crore and ₹225 crore respectively.

5.title: His condition is stable: SP after Mulayam Singh admitted to ICU
5.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh CM and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's condition is stable, the party said in a statement on Sunday. He was shifted to the intensive care unit (ICU) of Medanta Hospital in Gurugram earlier in the day. The Samajwadi Party said the 82-year-old leader is being treated under the supervision of senior doctors.

6.title: SEBI tightens disclosure norms for IPO-bound companies
6.article_body: SEBI approved new mandates including tightening of disclosure norms for IPO-bound companies. In its board meeting, the market regulator allowed companies for confidential pre-filing of offer documents along with relaxing open offer pricing rules for disinvestment of public sector undertakings (PSUs). As per the new norms, buying and selling of mutual funds falls under insider trading rules.

7.title: Windfall profit tax cut on domestic crude oil, diesel; scrapped for jet fuel
7.article_body: According to a Finance Ministry notification issued late Saturday night, the tax on domestically produced crude oil was reduced from ₹10,500 to ₹8,000 per tonne. The levy on the diesel export was reduced to ₹5 per litre from ₹10 per litre. The government also scrapped the export tax on jet fuel completely. All the changes will be effective immediately.

8.title: Karthi pens note after 'Ponniyin Selvan' collects ₹150 cr worldwide
8.article_body: Actor Karthi, who played Vallavaraiyan Vanthiyathevan in 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', took to Twitter and penned a note for his fans. "Words cannot express the immense gratitude I feel for this experience and magnificent journey as Vanthiyethevan...It's overwhelming to receive all your love," Karthi wrote. This comes after his film crossed ₹150 crore gross worldwide as per Trade analyst Ramesh Bala.

9.title: Kohli needed break to re-energise his battery: Shane Watson
9.article_body: Ex-Australian cricketer Shane Watson said that Indian batter Virat Kohli needed "some time off to re-energise his battery". "I could see from even far, during the last IPL, you could see his energy was low. He was trying to get his best," Watson said. He added, "He is at the peak of his powers...Great to see him at his best."

10.title: DPIIT to seek Cabinet nod for bill to decriminalise minor offences: Official
10.article_body: According to an official, the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) will soon seek the Cabinet's approval for The Ease of Doing Business and Ease of Living (Amendment of Provisions) Bill, 2022. The bill aims to decriminalise minor offences by rationalising about 110 provisions across 35 Acts under different ministries to ensure ease of doing business.

11.title: Rohit Sharma becomes first Indian to play 400 matches in T20 cricket history
11.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma has become the first-ever Indian cricketer to feature in 400 matches in T20 cricket history. India's second T20I against South Africa in Guwahati marks Rohit's 400th T20 match. West Indian all-rounder Kieron Pollard holds the record of playing the most number of T20 matches (614).

12.title: Ethiopia's 23-yr-old Yehualaw becomes youngest-ever winner of London marathon
12.article_body: Ethiopia's 23-year-old Yalemzerf Yehualaw became the youngest-ever winner of the London marathon, finishing in two hours, 17 minutes and 26 seconds. Notably, it's the third fastest women's London Marathon time in history. Yehualaw, who tripped during the run, said she's happy to win in London. Kenya's Amos Kipruto won the men's race in two hours, four minutes and 39 seconds.

13.title: 50-year-old man's body recovered from well in Rajasthan
13.article_body: The body of a 50-year-old man was recovered from a well at his farm in Haipura village in Rajasthan's Jhalawar district. The feet of the deceased, Hemraj Lodha, were tied with a towel, police said. There was a dispute between Hemraj and his two nephews, Vinod (33) and Mohan (22), over some portion of land, police added.

14.title: NASA finds mystery object stuck to Mars Helicopter's foot during latest flight
14.article_body: NASA said it noticed a mysterious object stuck to the foot of the Ingenuity Mars Helicopter during its latest flight on the red planet. "There's something on your foot, Mars Helicopter! We're looking into a bit of debris that ended up on Ingenuity's foot," said NASA while sharing visuals of the debris. The object didn't impact its flight, NASA said.

15.title: Muslims won't say 'Vande Mataram': SP's Abu Azmi on Maha govt's GR
15.article_body: SP leader Abu Azmi on Sunday said that Muslims won't say 'Vande Mataram' instead of 'hello' while addressing public or government officials and making announcements. His response came following the Maharashtra government's Government Resolution, directing government employees to greet with 'Vande Mataram' instead of 'hello'. Eknath Shinde has come under the pressure of BJP and RSS, Azmi added.

16.title: Officials warn of threat to Maharashtra CM Shinde's life; security tightened
16.article_body: The State Intelligence Department (SID) has received specific input about the threat to the life of Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde, following which his security has been tightened further, an official said on Sunday. Shinde already has a 'Z Plus' category security cover. Security has also been increased at Shinde's private residence in Thane and the official residence 'Varsha' in Mumbai.

17.title: Electric scooter battery explosion kills 7-year-old boy near Mumbai
17.article_body: A seven-year-old child was killed after the battery of an electric scooter exploded after overnight charging near Mumbai, police said. The incident took place on September 23 when the deceased's father had kept the battery on charge around 2:30 am before the sound of an explosion woke him up around 5:30 am. The deceased succumbed to injuries on September 30.

18.title: 35-year-old woman dies after being burnt alive by husband in Thane
18.article_body: A 35-year-old woman, who was allegedly burnt alive by her husband in Thane, died while undergoing treatment. The accused, who was having an affair, hatched a plan to get rid of his wife and two daughters (who are undergoing treatment) by burning them alive and making it look like an accident. The accused also got injured in the incident.

19.title: Jio to launch 4G-enabled laptop for ₹15,000: Report
19.article_body: Reliance Jio will be launching a laptop with an embedded 4G sim card for ₹15,000, Reuters reported on Sunday. The company has partnered with companies like Qualcomm and Microsoft for the 'JioBook'. The laptop will be available to enterprise customers like schools and government institutes from this month, with a consumer launch expected within the next three months.

20.title: FPIs withdraw ₹7,624 cr in Sept, turn net sellers after 2 months
20.article_body: After remaining net buyers in the last two months, foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have turned net sellers again in September and withdrawn ₹7,624 crore from Indian equity markets. Data with depositories showed that total outflow from Indian equity markets by FPIs has reached ₹1.68 lakh crore so far in 2022. FPIs had invested ₹51,200 crore in August.

21.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd T20I against South Africa
21.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma won the toss and elected to bowl first in the second T20I against India in Guwahati. India are fielding the same side that played in the first T20I. Meanwhile, South Africa have made one change to their playing XI, with Lungi Ngidi replacing Tabraiz Shamsi.

22.title: Indian women's team registers 1st win in Group 5 at World Team TT C'ships
22.article_body: Indian women's table tennis team defeated the Czech Republic 3-0 to register their first win in Group 5 at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in China on Sunday. Manika Batra and Diya Chitale won their respective matches 3-1, while Sreeja Akula won 3-0. India are currently second in the group standings. India lost to Germany in their first match.

23.title: Hyd Police foils conspiracy to kill BJP-RSS leaders, 3 held
23.article_body: The Commissioner's Taskforce, along with the state intelligence department on Sunday, foiled an attempt to assassinate BJP and RSS leaders by detaining a few suspects from Hyderabad's Malakpet area. The accused hatched the conspiracy at the behest of foreign handlers based in Pakistan, police said, adding that they got explosives to carry out the plan.

24.title: Leaders like Kharge can't bring change: Tharoor amid Cong Prez polls
24.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said that leaders like Mallikarjun Kharge can't bring change and will continue the existing system. "We aren't enemies, it's not war. It's a poll for our party's future. Kharge ji comes in the top three leaders of Congress," he said. I will bring change as per party workers' expectations, Tharoor said.

25.title: 13 firms sign non-disclosure agreement with govt to use ULIP data
25.article_body: As many as 13 firms have signed a non-disclosure agreement with the government to access data from the Unified Logistics Interface Platform (ULIP), the Commerce and Industry Ministry said on Saturday. The 13 firms include MapmyIndia and Yes Bank. It added that 11 more organisations, including Bosch India, Portlinks and Shiprocket, are in the process of signing the agreement.

26.title: India squad for ODI series against South Africa announced
26.article_body: The BCCI on Sunday announced Team India squad for the upcoming ODI series against South Africa. Shikhar Dhawan has been named the captain of the squad, while Shreyas Iyer will be his deputy. Batter Rajat Patidar and fast bowler Mukesh Kumar have received their maiden Team India call-ups. The squad also includes Mohammed Siraj, Avesh Khan and Shahbaz Ahmed.

27.title: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav reaches Gurugram hospital where Mulayam is admitted
27.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday reached Medanta Hospital in Gurugram where his father and SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav has been admitted. Mulayam has been shifted to the intensive care unit at the hospital. The 82-year-old has been undergoing treatment for the last few weeks. UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya wished him a speedy recovery.

28.title: Truly blessed, humbled: 'Tanhaji' director on winning 3 National Awards
28.article_body: Filmmaker Om Raut took to Instagram after his film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' won three National Awards. "I'm truly blessed...humbled and will use this honour, that's bestowed upon me, as a symbol to try harder to entertain everyone for years to come," he wrote. The film won a National Award for Best Popular Film, Best Costume Design and Best Actor.

29.title: We were going to end 'Brahmāstra 1' with Dev's face reveal: Ayan
29.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji said they were going to end 'Brahmāstra: Part One' with Dev's face reveal. "It was with a lot of thought...to create some curiosity in the minds of the audiences that we ended the film where we did," Ayan added. Ayan said Dev could be the "most exciting character" he will be taking on in his career.

30.title: Heroin worth ₹34 cr concealed in trolley bag seized at Mumbai airport
30.article_body: Around five kilograms of heroin, worth ₹34 crore, which was concealed in a cavity inside a trolley bag, was seized by the Customs department at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport on Sunday. A passenger has been held by the officials. In another incident, a woman was held with cocaine worth ₹4.9 crore at the Mumbai airport.

31.title: Increased repo rate big dampener for us: Automobile industry body
31.article_body: Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) President MR Singhania said hike in repo rate is a "big dampener" for the automobile industry, particularly for price-sensitive entry-level two-wheelers and passenger vehicles segments. RBI on Friday raised repo rate by 50 bps, the fourth straight increase since May 2022. Manufacturers of two-wheelers hiked prices five times in 2021, he added.

32.title: AAP to form govt in Gujarat, says Kejriwal; cites 'IB report'
32.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, while citing an "Intelligence Bureau report", said that AAP will form the government in Gujarat if elections are held on Sunday. However, he claimed that his party will form the government in Gujarat with a very thin margin and urged the people of the state to give a "big push" to AAP.

33.title: OPEC+ to consider oil output cut of over 1 million barrels per day: Reports
33.article_body: According to reports, OPEC+ is mulling an oil output cut of over a million barrels per day when it meets on October 5. OPEC+, consisting of OPEC countries and allies like Russia, will meet in person in Vienna for the first time since March 2020. The output cuts are being considered after the fall in global oil rates.

34.title: 198-kg meth, 9-kg cocaine worth ₹1,476 crore seized in Navi Mumbai
34.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) seized 198 kg of methamphetamine and 9 kg of cocaine, totalling ₹1,476 crore in Navi Mumbai. The department said the consignment belonged to drug cartels in South Africa, and India was being used as a transit country. "They conceal drugs in the boxes of Valencia oranges imported from South Africa," said an official.

35.title: Rosy breaks 8-yr-old women's pole vault national record at 36th National Games
35.article_body: Rosy Meena Paulraj of Tamil Nadu won a gold medal after setting a new national record of 4.20m in the women's pole vault event at 36th National Games on Saturday. The 25-year-old broke the previous mark of 4.15m set by VS Surekha in 2014. Surekha set the record in New Delhi. The 36th National Games are being held in Gujarat.

36.title: He is more than just an off-spinner: Eng's Ben Duckett on Ashwin
36.article_body: English batter Ben Duckett said that India's Ravichandran Ashwin is "more than just an off-spinner". "He (Ashwin) spins it both ways. He is incredible. I was lucky to play with him when he played for Nottinghamshire and I was facing him in the nets every time I could," Duckett said. He added, "If I face Ashwin in India...it would...[be] hard.''

37.title: Gujarat Giants' Chris Gayle dances with Kalbeliya artistes, video goes viral
37.article_body: Chris Gayle, who is playing for Gujarat Giants in the Legends League Cricket, danced with Kalbeliya artistes to celebrate Navratri. A video of the same has gone viral on social media. Gujarat Giants shared the video, writing, "The Universe Boss @chrisgayle333 dancing on the dhol beats to celebrate Navratri!" Gayle has scored 83 runs in the tournament so far.

38.title: Looking for duel with ex-teammate Mitchell Johnson in LLC 2022: Lee
38.article_body: Ex-Australian pacer Brett Lee said that it would be fun to play alongside former Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh in the Legends League Cricket 2022, where Lee has recently joined the Manipal Tigers team. "I am looking for a duel with my old teammate Mitchell Johnson...After checking in, I had a nice interaction with Chris Gayle," Lee said.

39.title: Twitter posts the first-ever edited tweet
39.article_body: Twitter has sent out the first-ever edited tweet that is publicly visible, showing users how the tweets will look when the feature is rolled out. The tweet about testing the feature was posted by Twitter Blue, the official account of Twitter's monthly subscription service. Edited tweets appear with an icon, timestamp, and label to show the original tweet was modified.

40.title: I support BJP: Auto driver who invited AAP's Kejriwal for dinner in Ahmedabad
40.article_body: Auto-rickshaw driver Vikram Dantani, who invited Delhi CM and AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal to his house for dinner in Gujarat's Ahmedabad last month, said that he has always been a BJP supporter. He attended PM Narendra Modi's rally in Gujarat on Friday. "I invited Kejriwal for dinner because I was asked to do so by auto union leaders," Dantani said.

41.title: Government issues draft guidelines for listing of regional rural banks
41.article_body: The Finance Ministry issued draft guidelines to enable regional rural banks (RRBs) to raise resources by listing on stock exchanges. According to the guidelines, RBRs would require a net worth of at least ₹300 crore during the previous three years. They should also possess capital adequacy above the regulatory minimum level of 9% in each of the previous three years.

42.title: Ex-UP CM & Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav shifted to ICU at Gurugram hospital
42.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister and Samajwadi Party leader Mulayam Singh Yadav has been shifted to the intensive care unit (ICU) at the Medanta Hospital in Gurugram. The 82-year-old has been undergoing treatment for the last few weeks. His son and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav is reportedly on his way to Delhi.

43.title: Saif, Hrithik are just outstanding in 'Vikram Vedha': Kareena Kapoor
43.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan reviewed her husband and actor Saif Ali Khan's film 'Vikram Vedha' and said that the film is "absolutely fantastic". "The storytelling, the performances, just everything about the movie (was fantastic)...Saif and Hrithik are just outstanding in the film," she added. Kareena stated she loves watching "commercial, blockbuster" kinds of films.

44.title: Playing 5 games before Super 12 in T20 WC will be to SL's advantage: Shanaka
44.article_body: Ahead of T20 World Cup, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said the five matches which his side is going to play in Australia will be to their advantage because they can read the conditions and wickets going into Super 12 stage. SL haven't directly qualified for Super 12. They'll play two warm-up matches and three matches in the group stage.

45.title: Indian men's team beat 2nd seeds Germany at World Team TT Championships
45.article_body: Indian men's table tennis team beat second seeds Germany 3-1 in their second group stage match at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in China on Sunday. Sathiyan Gnanasekaran won both his matches. Harmeet Desai lost his singles match, while Manav Thakkar won. India are currently third in Group 2 standings. India will face Kazakhstan in their third match.

46.title: 97% mobiles used in India now are Made-in-India against 10% in 2014: Minister
46.article_body: Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said around 97% of the smartphones sold in India today are domestically produced as against 90% imports in 2014. State governments should proactively participate in Centre's projects to generate investment and employment in sectors like electronics, he said. "We'll make the internet open, safe, trusted and accountable," he added.

47.title: 4 of family, including 2 children, killed in road accident in MP
47.article_body: Four members of a family were killed and another person was injured after a truck rammed into their car near Berkhedi village in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district. The deceased, Mohit Shukla (38), his wife Raksha (36) and their two daughters, aged 11 and 7 years, were returning from Kanpur, UP. The accused truck driver has been arrested, police said.

48.title: Inflation will average 5.2% next fiscal, assuming normal rains: RB
48.article_body: According to RBI's 'Monetary Policy Report September 2022', average inflation will be 5.2% in 2023-24, assuming "a normal monsoon, a progressive normalisation of supply chains, and no further exogenous or policy shocks". The central bank is mandated to keep retail inflation in a range of 2-6%. The RBI recently hiked the repo rate to 5.9% to bring inflation under control.

49.title: BJP has dozens who are on bail: Shivakumar on Bommai's 'fake Gandhis' remark
49.article_body: Reacting to Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai’s ‘fake Gandhis’ comment, Congress leader DK Shivakumar said that BJP has dozens who are on bail. "Yes, I'm on bail. Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi are also on bail...Yediyurappa has no case against him? Bommai registered cases against me. Let him send me to Parappana Agrahara (Central Jail)," he said.

50.title: Insolvency cases involving nearly ₹10.5 lakh cr disposed of in 5 yrs: NCLT
50.article_body: National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has disposed of insolvency cases amounting to nearly ₹10.5 lakh crore in last five years, said NCLT President Chief Justice (Retired) Ramalingam Sudhakar. Of the total, 23,608 cases amounting to ₹7.21 lakh crore have been settled before admission. Resolution plans have been approved in 565 cases, involving an amount of ₹3.03 lakh crore, Sudhakar added.

51.title: Will wear PayCM t-shirt, let's see what BJP will do: DK Shivakumar
51.article_body: The Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar dared the government to take action against him for wearing the PayCM t-shirt, alleging that several party workers were booked for wearing the same t-shirt. "Congress leaders will participate in the Bharat Jodo Yatra by wearing PayCM t-shirts. Let’s see what the BJP will do...We are not afraid of this (cases)," said Shivakumar.

52.title: As PM Modi desires, India will take lead in 6G: Ashwini Vaishnaw
52.article_body: Union Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Sunday said India will take a lead in 6G as it's PM Narendra Modi’s desire to take a "global lead in 6G". His statement came a day after PM Modi launched 5G services in selected cities. Meanwhile, Union Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said 5G technology will transform life of every Indian.

53.title: Traffic on Mumbai-B'luru highway resumes after old Pune bridge razed
53.article_body: Traffic resumed on the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway near Chandani Chowk in Pune on Sunday morning after debris created by the demolition of the old bridge was cleared. The traffic was diverted since last night. The Chandani Chowk bridge in Pune was demolished using 600 kg of emulsion explosives as it was causing a traffic bottleneck.

54.title: Delhi teacher stabs wife in front of 9-yr-old daughter after an argument
54.article_body: A government school teacher stabbed his wife in front of their nine-year-old daughter in Delhi. The woman died after sustaining serious injuries. The man stabbed the woman following an argument. The daughter told the police that her father stabbed her mother using a knife. When police reached the spot, the woman was found dead and the man was missing.

55.title: It'll be tough call between Shami, Chahar in Bumrah's absence: Aakash
55.article_body: Amid uncertainty over Jasprit Bumrah's participation in the upcoming T20 WC, commentator Aakash Chopra has said India should've picked five pacers in their squad for the tournament. "If Bumrah is not available, then India will have to make a tough call between Mohammad Shami and Deepak Chahar," he added. Shami and Chahar both are among standby players for the WC.

56.title: Fake call centre cheating US citizens busted in Thane, 16 arrested
56.article_body: Thane Police raided a fake call centre and arrested 16 people reportedly involved in cheating US citizens on the pretext of providing loans. "After obtaining their bank account details, the accused would siphon off funds from their accounts," said the police. An agent coordinating in the US would collect the money and transfer it to India through 'hawala'.

57.title: Senior Assam police official shares pic with Rohit Sharma, says 'A century is must'
57.article_body: Senior Assam police official Ponjit Dowarah took to his Twitter account to share a picture of himself with Team India captain Rohit Sharma. He wrote, "Best of luck. Ek century ban ta hein (A century is must)." This comes ahead of India's second T20I against South Africa, which will take place in Guwahati tonight.

58.title: PCB should ask Babar Azam if captaincy is taking a toll on him: Miandad
58.article_body: Ex-Pakistan batter Javed Miandad has said that PCB should have an "honest" conversation with Babar Azam and ask him if captaincy is taking a toll on him. "If Babar feels he can't perform [both]...then the captaincy shouldn't stay with him," added Miandad. Notably, Babar has scored a century and a fifty in the ongoing seven-match T20I series against England.

59.title: Difficult for those in power to walk in Gandhiji's footsteps: Rahul
59.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on the occasion of Mahatma Gandhi's 153rd birth anniversary on Sunday said, "[It's] convenient for those in power to appropriate Gandhiji's legacy but difficult to walk in his footsteps." He added that amid politics of violence and lies, Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra will "spread message of ahimsa and swaraj".

60.title: Builder, 8 others booked for embezzling ₹15 crore in Gurugram
60.article_body: A builder and eight others have been booked for allegedly embezzling ₹15 crore from 20 people by offering to sell them shops-cum-offices (SCO) at a township in Farrukhnagar in Gurugram's Sector 3. The complainants alleged that despite taking initial payments from 28 individuals for SCOs, the accused did not obtain the Department of Town and Country Planning license, police said.

61.title: Govt extends concessional customs duty on edible oil import till March 2023
61.article_body: The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) has extended existing concessional import duties on specified edible oils up to March 31, 2023. The government, in its notification, said that the move was aimed at increasing domestic supply and keeping prices under control. The concessional customs duty on edible oil import was also extended till March 2023.

62.title: Suspected Chinese hackers attacked Canadian chat programme: Report
62.article_body: Suspected Chinese hackers tampered with a widely used software distributed by a Canada-based customer service company Comm100, cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike said in a blog post. CrowdStrike executive Adam Meyers said hackers were suspected to be Chinese because of their behaviour patterns and language in the code. Chinese government has rejected the claim, accusing the US of spreading lies.

63.title: Bommai calls Sonia & Rahul 'fake Gandhis', says Congress out on bail
63.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai called Congress leaders Sonia and Rahul "fake Gandhis" and said that the whole Congress party is out on bail. "Today is Gandhi Jayanti. Why should I talk about fake Gandhis? Rahul Gandhi, Sonia Gandhi and DK Shivakumar are out on bail," he said. Bommai further added that Karnataka was an ATM for the Congress party.

64.title: US, Australia, Japan express concern over China at trilateral meet
64.article_body: US, Australia and Japan's defence ministers held a trilateral meeting in Hawaii on Saturday. "We're deeply concerned by China's...bullying behaviour in...Taiwan Strait, and elsewhere in the region," US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said in his opening remarks. Moreover, Australian Defence Minister Richard Marles said that China is trying to "shape the world...in a way that we've not seen before."

65.title: Raj MLAs got agitated over name of 'new CM': Gehlot on Raj political crisis
65.article_body: While addressing the political crisis in the state, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that the MLAs got agitated when Sachin Pilot's name was raised to succeed him as the CM of the state. "When a CM is changed, 80-90% (MLAs) leave him and switch sides. They turn to the new candidate. I too don't consider it wrong," he said.

66.title: Dan Wieden, the man behind Nike's 'Just Do It' slogan, passes away at 77
66.article_body: Dan Wieden, the Co-founder of the US-based advertising agency 'Wieden+Kennedy' who coined Nike's 'Just Do It' slogan, passed away at the age of 77 on Friday. The agency, co-founded by Wieden with late David Kennedy, has created campaigns for big companies like McDonald's, Samsung, Old Spice and others. "We will miss you so much," the company's Twitter account said.

67.title: Kolkata prison inmates to get mutton, paneer, dum aloo in special Pujo meals
67.article_body: All 2,500 prisoners at Presidency Central Correctional Home in south Kolkata will get special Durga Pujo meals for four days from October 2 to October 5. An official said that the inmates will get dum aloo, paneer masala, mutton biryani, fried rice and chilli chicken as part of different meals. Rasgullas and laddus will also be served.

68.title: Kareena Kapoor & Saif Ali Khan buy new Mercedes car worth ₹2 crore; pics surface
68.article_body: Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan have purchased a Mercedes-Benz S 350d worth ₹2 crore. In visuals that surfaced on social media, Kareena could be seen holding her son Jeh as she unveiled the new car at her residence. Recently, the couple also bought a Jeep Wrangler Rubicon, which costs around ₹60 lakh.

69.title: Arbaaz & I are happier, calmer people after divorce: Malaika Arora
69.article_body: Malaika Arora has said that she has a "much better relationship" with her ex-husband and actor Arbaaz Khan. "We're just happier, calmer people. He's (Arbaaz) a wonderful man, I only wish him the best in life," she stated. Malaika added that she is happy she made these decisions. "For women out there...Don't be afraid to follow your heart," Malaika stated.

70.title: Russia blocks SoundCloud for spreading 'false information'
70.article_body: Russia has restricted access to music-streaming app SoundCloud for spreading "false information" about what Moscow calls a "special military operation" in Ukraine, Interfax reported citing communications watchdog Roskomnadzor. The information was related to Russia's methods of warfare, including "attacks on civilians, strikes on civilian infrastructure", used in the "special operation", it added.

71.title: Gourav Vallabh, Deepender Hooda, Syed Hussain resign as Cong spokespersons
71.article_body: Congress leaders Gourav Vallabh, Deepender S Hooda and Syed Naseer Hussain on Saturday resigned from the post of official spokesperson of the party. Vallabh said that this has been done to campaign for the election of Mallikarjun Kharge as party President. "[We] want this election to be free and fair," Vallabh said.

72.title: Policeman martyred, CRPF personnel injured in terror attack in J&K's Pulwama
72.article_body: A police personnel was martyred and a CRPF personnel was injured as terrorists opened fire on a checkpost in Pulwama in Jammu and Kashmir on Sunday. Kashmir Zone Police said that a reinforcement was sent and the area is being cordoned off. This comes hours after a terrorist, linked to LeT, was shot dead in an encounter in Shopian.

73.title: Entered Congress Presidential polls to strengthen party: Kharge
73.article_body: Congress Presidential polls candidate Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday said that he has not entered the party's Presidential polls to oppose anyone but to strengthen the party. Kharge added that in line with 'one person, one post' principle of the party, he resigned as the Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha on the day he filed the nomination.

74.title: Ready to face punishment if guilty in Ankita's murder case: Revenue official
74.article_body: Uttarakhand Revenue Sub-Inspector Vaibhav Pratap Singh, who was suspended for his suspicious role in Vanantara resort receptionist Ankita Bhandari's murder case, has denied the allegations levelled against him and said he is "ready to face any punishment" if found guilty. Singh further said that he didn't file the missing FIR immediately since he didn't have Ankita's family contact information.

75.title: WazirX lays off 40% employees, says 'Reduced staff to weather crypto winter'
75.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange WazirX has responded to reports claiming that the startup has laid off 40% of its employees. "Our priority is to be financially stable...To achieve this, we have had to reduce our staff to weather the crypto winter," the company said. Earlier, CoinDesk said WazirX laid off 50-70 employees and told them they would be paid for 45 days.

76.title: Plastic water bottle thrown at Arvind Kejriwal at garba event in Gujarat
76.article_body: A plastic water bottle was thrown at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal during a garba event in Gujarat's Rajkot. AAP leaders said the bottle did not hit him and passed over his head. Kejriwal was accompanied by security officials and senior party leaders at the event. The Aam Aadmi Party said there was no need to approach the police.

77.title: BSNL could launch 5G services by August 2023: Ashwini Vaishnaw
77.article_body: Telecom operator Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) could launch 5G services on its network by August 2023, Union Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Saturday. "BSNL should start rolling out 5G by August of next year. That way, we'll have a good three private player-one public sector player ecosystem," Vaishnaw said. "India would remain an affordable [5G] market," he added.

78.title: Mughals, the British presence are also our history: Sobhita Dhulipala
78.article_body: 'Ponniyin Selvan' actress Sobhita Dhulipala responded to a question about making a film on "our history". Sobhita said the British presence in India, the Mughal rule and the Cholas or the Pallavas are "our history". "India constantly has had a foreign presence...a constant shift in the rulers...it's difficult to draw a line between what is ours...what isn't," she added.

79.title: I love seeing KL Rahul bat when he feels like he has nothing to lose: Watson
79.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has termed India's KL Rahul as one of his favourite batters who "takes the game on" and is not always trying to "control the game". Referring to talks over the batter's strike rate in recent matches, Watson said, "When Rahul feels like he's got nothing to lose, then he can even strike at 180."

80.title: Delhi govt to connect all unauthorised colonies with sewer system
80.article_body: The Delhi government will connect all unauthorised colonies and villages with sewer system to prevent effluents from flowing into the Yamuna and polluting it. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia approved various Delhi Jal Board projects on these lines, an official statement said. Delhi government will conduct a study on newly constructed lakes to assess the groundwater flow, the statement added.

81.title: Militants shoot dead Pakistani UN peacekeeper in Congo
81.article_body: A Pakistani soldier working as a UN peacekeeper was shot dead in a militant attack at a permanent operation base of the UN in Congo's Minembwe, Pakistan's military said in a statement. A group of six militants arrived at the base to apparently surrender their weapons, however, the group's leader started firing indiscriminately, according to the statement.

82.title: Teacher consumes alcohol during class in UP school, video showing beer cans surfaces
82.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a teacher sitting in the classroom while being allegedly drunk in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras. In the video, students can be seen sitting on the floor, with the teacher being caught with two beer cans. As per District Information Office, Hathras, the teacher has been suspended.

83.title: 4 women labourers washed away while crossing a submerged bridge in K'taka
83.article_body: Four women labourers were washed away in a stream while crossing a submerged bridge on their way home from work in the Koppal district of Karnataka on Saturday. The victims were aged 22, 28, 32 and 40 years. Two other women who were accompanying them managed to hold tree roots near the banks and were rescued by locals.

84.title: Happy to be back with team I love the most: India Women batter Jemimah
84.article_body: India Women batter Jemimah Rodrigues, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in her first match in Women's Asia Cup after an injury, said, "More than anything I was just happy to be back...with the team I love the most." The 22-year-old has recovered from a wrist injury that had ruled her out of the recent England series.

85.title: Rahul pays tribute to Mahatma, says Bapu taught us to walk on path of truth
85.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi paid floral tribute to Mahatma Gandhi on his 153rd birth anniversary. He took to Twitter and said, "Bapu taught us to walk on the path of truth and non-violence...Today on Gandhi Jayanti, we take a pledge, just as he united the country against injustice, we will now unite our India."

86.title: India's cleanest city Indore earns crores by processing 1,900 tonnes of waste daily
86.article_body: Indore, which has been named India's cleanest city for the sixth straight time by the government, processes 1,900 tonnes of urban waste every day which earns it crores of rupees, according to officials. The bio-CNG generated from the waste also helps in running the buses in the city. As many as 850 vehicles collect waste from households and business establishments.

87.title: Twitter banned 57,643 accounts from Jul 26-Aug 25 for child sexual exploitation
87.article_body: Twitter on Saturday said it banned 57,643 accounts in India between July 26 and August 25 for promoting child sexual exploitation, non-consensual nudity and allied content. Twitter added that it received 1,088 complaints from its users in the same time period and took action against 41 URLs. "We processed 76 grievances which were appealing Twitter account suspensions," Twitter added.

88.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra a battle with ideology which killed Mahatma Gandhi: Rahul
88.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said that 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is a battle with the ideology which killed Mahatma Gandhi. Gandhi said that BJP's politics is based on 'himsa and asatya' (violence and falsehood), adding that the yatra "will spread the message of ahimsa and swaraj (non-violence and self-governance)."

89.title: We're not playing against Haaland, we're playing vs Man City: Man Utd's Ten Hag
89.article_body: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag has said their focus will not be entirely on Norwegian striker Erling Haaland when they face Manchester City in their Premier League match on Sunday. "We're not playing against Haaland, we're playing against Manchester City," stated Ten Hag. Haaland has scored 11 goals in seven EPL games this season so far.

90.title: Sought a ban many times: Prof whose hand was chopped off by PFI men in Kerala
90.article_body: Professor TJ Joseph, whose hand was chopped off by PFI activists, stated that he sought a ban on the organisation several times. "There's no doubt that this is a terrorist organisation that kills, terrorises, that aims to establish an Islamic reign," he said. Joseph's right palm was chopped off by PFI men 12 years back for alleged blasphemy.

91.title: 15-year-old domestic worker dies of electrocution in Gurugram
91.article_body: A 15-year-old girl hired as a domestic worker at a Palam Vihar residence in Gurugram allegedly died of electrocution from a live wire. Based on a complaint filed by the deceased's elder sister, the house owner has been booked under IPC Section 302 (murder). Notably, the wire's covering was damaged, causing the metal gate to get electrified, police said.

92.title: SMEs raised ₹1,460 crore via 87 IPOs from January-September 2022
92.article_body: Small and medium enterprises (SMEs) have raised ₹1,460 crore through 87 initial public offerings (IPOs) between January and September 2022. The amount raised is 86.4% higher than the ₹783 crore that 56 SMEs raised in 2021, industry data showed. Of the 29 SME IPOs that have been launched in September 2022 alone, 25 have been concluded while four are ongoing.

93.title: 600 kg emulsion explosives used to demolish Pune's Chandani Chowk bridge
93.article_body: The Chandani Chowk bridge in Pune was demolished using 600 kg of emulsion explosives. About 350 people were part of the demolition drive and 15 JCBs, 10 forkland machines and 30 heavy trucks were employed to remove the debris after the demolition. This bridge was causing traffic on the busy national highway connecting Mumbai and Bengaluru.

94.title: Fresh round of allotment for Hyd's Rajiv Swagruha flats as allottees back out
94.article_body: The Telangana government has decided to allot the leftover Rajiv Swagruha flats in two townships (Bandlaguda and Pocharam) through a fresh round of lottery draw. The flats will be allotted to those who have already applied by paying ₹1,000 application fee, officials said. The move comes after many applicants who were allotted flats earlier did not proceed with the purchase.

95.title: 6-yr-old killed in 'human sacrifice' at under-construction CRPF HQ in Delhi
95.article_body: Two men allegedly killed a six-year-old as "human sacrifice" by slitting his throat in Delhi's Lodhi Colony, police said. The incident took place at the under-construction Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) headquarters. The accused stated that he saw 'Bhole Baba', who wanted him to slit the child's throat, said DCP (south) Chandan Chowdhary.

96.title: Conspiracy by enemies: Taliban as 35 die in Kabul suicide blast
96.article_body: Taliban government's Foreign Affairs Ministry has stated that the attacks carried out on mosques, educational centres and other public places are "a conspiracy by the enemies of the Afghan people". This comes as the death toll in the suicide blast at an education centre in Kabul rose to at least 35, according to United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA).

97.title: Someone told Kareena I'll only do TV now when I did 'Sacred...': Saif
97.article_body: Saif Ali Khan revealed someone had told his wife Kareena Kapoor that Saif will only do TV after he had accepted to be a part of 'Sacred Games'. "That's when 'Sacred Games' wasn't even a TV show, it was for an OTT platform," he added. "You can stay relevant as a person if you keep your thoughts new...updated," Saif stated.

98.title: 5 masked men enter Maharashtra bank with swords, video surfaces
98.article_body: Five masked men entered a bank with swords in Maharashtra's Nanded. A video of the incident was shared by News18 Lokmat. Locals and bank employees managed to catch one man, reports said. The incident took place in the Sindhi area of the Umri district. The video was retweeted by several people.

99.title: 14-year-old boy tied to pole and beaten over suspicion of theft in Karnataka
99.article_body: A 14-year-old Dalit boy was tied to a pole and thrashed by locals over suspicion of stealing earrings in Karnataka's Chikkaballapur. "They asked us which caste we belong to and said that people of our caste shouldn't live in their village and that we should all be killed," said the boy's mother, who was also attacked. Three people were arrested.

100.title: In high-scoring Aus series, Axar was at his economical best: Ashwin
100.article_body: Praising Axar Patel, Ravichandran Ashwin said the 28-year-old has impressed with his orthodox left-arm spin bowling in a world where the focus is on mystery spin, googly and wrist spin. "In a high-scoring series [vs Australia], he was at his economical best...Pure value for putting the ball where he wants to and varying his pace, line and length," added Ashwin.

101.title: Locals stage protest in Delhi's Sunder Nagri after 25-yr-old murdered
101.article_body: After the murder of a 25-year-old man in Delhi's Sunder Nagri area, angry locals staged a protest demanding a speedy probe into the matter. A police force has been deployed in the area as a precautionary measure to avoid any untoward situation. According to Delhi Police, the motive behind the murder seems to be an old enmity.

102.title: Moderna refused China's request to provide vaccine tech: Report
102.article_body: Moderna had refused to provide China with the intellectual property behind the development of mRNA vaccine, citing commercial and safety concerns, according to the Financial Times. The report said that Moderna had "given up" on efforts to access the Chinese market because of the country's demand to hand over the technology as a prerequisite for selling it in the country.

103.title: TV actress Anaya Soni suffers kidney failure, says 'Condition is serious'
103.article_body: TV actress Anaya Soni, who has featured in shows like 'Crime Patrol', took to Instagram to reveal she has suffered kidney failure. She said she will get hospitalised on Monday, adding, "My creatinine have come to 15.76 and hemoglobin is 6.7. Condition is serious." She stated, "[I'll] soon have to go with my kidney transplant...Will apply for kidney post dialysis."

104.title: Sunil Mittal praises Mukesh Ambani, says 'We had to run very fast to catch up on 4G'
104.article_body: Bharti Airtel's Sunil Mittal has praised rival company Reliance Jio's efforts to push 4G technology in India. "I would like to remind Mukesh (Ambani) when he gave a lot of pace to 4G and we had run very fast to catch up with it," he acknowledged. He further said the country's pulse didn't stop for a minute when COVID-19 hit.

105.title: Rare Hermès 'Himalaya' bag sells for ₹2.8 crore at auction; pics surface
105.article_body: A rare Hermès Himalaya Retourné Kelly 25 bag was sold for €352,800 (more than ₹2.8 crore) at a Sotheby's auction in Paris. The handbag, in 'mother-of-pearl white' colour, is reminiscent of a snowy mountain landscape. It is "one of the hardest bags to obtain" in a Hermès boutique, a Sotheby's executive said.

106.title: Apple adds iPhone 6 to its 'vintage' products list
106.article_body: Apple has added iPhone 6 to its list of vintage products as it has been over five years since it was last offered for sale. The iPhone 6 Plus was added to the list earlier this year. Apple has moved the 2012 iPod nano 7 and the fifth-generation iPod touch from the vintage list to the obsolete list.

107.title: 31-yr-old man kills wife at Hyderabad lodge over suspicion of affair
107.article_body: A 31-year-old security guard allegedly strangulated his 21-year-old wife to death at a lodge on Saturday over suspicion of an affair with his brother in Hyderabad’s Afzalgunj. The man checked into the lodge with the victim and allegedly killed her, police said. Later, he walked into the police station and surrendered.

108.title: Sidhu Moosewala murder accused gangster Tinu escapes police custody: Reports
108.article_body:
Gangster Deepak Tinu, an accused in the Sidhu Moosewala murder case, escaped police custody in Punjab's Mansa district on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday, according to reports. 
"We are working on it, police parties are on the job and we will catch him soon," reports quoted police as saying. Tinu is a close aide of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi.

109.title: Will re-evaluate safety: Indonesia minister as 174 die in football match stampede
109.article_body: Indonesia's Youth and Sports Minister Zainudin Amali said on Sunday that authorities will re-evaluate safety at football matches as the death toll from a stampede and riot at a match in East Java rose to 174. "This is a regrettable incident that injures our football at a time when supporters can watch football matches from the stadium," he added.

110.title: Meghalaya HC grants bail to BJP leader accused of running sex racket
110.article_body: The Meghalaya High Court granted conditional bail to BJP state Vice President Bernard N Marak, who is accused of running a sex racket at his farmhouse. The court directed Marak not to abscond or tamper with evidence and to cooperate in the investigation. He was also asked to furnish a personal bond of ₹50,000.

111.title: Google Translate discontinued in mainland China due to 'low usage'
111.article_body: Google has discontinued Google Translate in mainland China "due to low usage". Earlier, reports said Google had disabled access to the service in parts of China, redirecting visitors to the Hong Kong domain. The reports added that it had swapped the Translate interface at translate.google.cn with a generic Google Search page.

112.title: 3-day-old body of man found in bathroom of a PG in Bengaluru
112.article_body: The body of a 24-year-old man was found in a bathroom of a paying guest (PG) facility in Bengaluru, nearly three days after he died, the police said. The deceased, identified as HS Anil Kumar, used to work as a writer in a private firm and lived in a PG at Govindaraja Nagar. Kumar's body was found by housekeeping staff.

113.title: Free & quality education should be arranged for every child: Sisodia
113.article_body: Deputy CM of Delhi Manish Sisodia said arrangements for free and quality education should be made for every child in the country. "Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and I have a dream that every child of Delhi should get a wonderful school to study, where they should be given world-class education free of cost," Sisodia added.

114.title: NASA pushes Artemis I launch to Nov after Hurricane Ian delays launch
114.article_body: NASA is now planning to launch the Artemis l mission between November 12-27. The announcement comes after Hurricane Ian scrubbed its plans to launch the mission on September 27. The storm forced NASA to roll Artemis l off the launch pad at Florida's Kennedy Space Center. The facility was hit by the hurricane in which Artemis l suffered no damage.

115.title: UN chief asks people to 'embrace peace' on int'l non-violence day
115.article_body: UN Secretary-General António Guterres on the occasion of International Day of Non-Violence on Sunday said that on this day, "we celebrate Mahatma Gandhi's birthday and values of peace, respect and the essential dignity shared by everyone." He added that by embracing these values and working across cultures and borders, "we can defeat today's challenges...to build a better future".

116.title: Suryakumar's purple patch can't be described in words: Ashwin
116.article_body: Speaking on his YouTube channel, spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said Suryakumar Yadav's purple patch can't be described in words. "We have Maxwell, Neesham, Pollard, Tim David, Hardik and Karthik on the world's best finishers list...But Suryakumar has the best strike rate amongst them," added Ashwin. Notably, Suryakumar has already recorded the most T20I runs among Indians in 2022 (732 runs).

117.title: Concerns about functioning of SC collegium can’t be brushed aside: Ex-CJI
117.article_body: Ex-CJI NV Ramana said concerns raised in different quarters, including by the government, relating to functioning of the Supreme Court collegium system cannot be brushed aside. The Supreme Court passed a series of judgments declaring the collegium system necessary to ensure independence of the judiciary but judiciary is merely one of the many players involved in the process, he added.

118.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann breaks into bhangra at garba event in Gujarat, video goes viral
118.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister and AAP leader Bhagwant Mann took part in a garba event in Rajkot, Gujarat on Saturday. In a video that has gone viral on social media, Mann is seen breaking into bhangra after a few steps of garba on public request. Aam Aadmi Party MP Raghav Chadha also participated in a garba event in Vadodara.

119.title: 66 e-scooters, 132 batteries stolen from warehouse in Gurugram
119.article_body: A total of 66 e-scooters, 132 batteries and several chargers were stolen from a warehouse of a logistics company in Gurugram's Sector 52, police officials said. The suspects tried to take away more vehicles as 18 of them were either found to be damaged or with their locks broken, the police added. An FIR has been registered against unidentified suspects.

120.title: Bihar Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh, who criticised his own government, resigns
120.article_body: Bihar Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh, who had recently criticised his own government's policies, has resigned. Singh had said that there is no wing of the state Agricultural Department that does not commit acts of theft.  He had also called himself a "sardar of thieves". Later, he had said that he stood by his words and will not amend his statement.

121.title: Huge avalanche hits Nepal's Manaslu Base Camp; video surfaces
121.article_body: A video of a huge avalanche hitting the Manaslu Base Camp in Nepal on Sunday has surfaced online. This is the second avalanche to take place in Nepal since the one that occurred on September 26 left two persons dead. A person who was trying to climb Mount Manaslu said that there were no human casualties, reported ANI.

122.title: Richa Chadha & Ali Fazal share pics from their phool haldi, mehendi events
122.article_body: Actors Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal on Sunday took to their respective Instagram handles to share photos from their mehendi, phool haldi and sangeet ceremonies held at Delhi's Gymkhana Club on Friday. They will reportedly get married in the first week of October and later host their reception at a contemporary furniture store inside a 176-year-old mill in Mumbai.

123.title: Vote for Kharge if satisfied with Congress' working: Tharoor
123.article_body: Ahead of Congress Presidential poll, party leader Shashi Tharoor said this isn't a battle. "I'm saying that if you're satisfied with the party's working, vote for [Mallikarjun] Kharge sahab. If you want a change, I'm there but there's no ideological problem," Tharoor added. Tharoor and party veteran Mallikarjun Kharge are contesting the election, scheduled on October 17.

124.title: Deaths due to stampede, riot after football match in Indonesia rise to 174
124.article_body: The death toll due to stampede and riot after a football match in Indonesia's East Java has risen to 174, authorities said on Sunday. Police said that when supporters of the losing home team invaded the pitch to express their frustration, officers fired tear gas in an attempt to control the situation, triggering a stampede and cases of suffocation.

125.title: Gehlot backs Mallikarjun Kharge in Congress chief poll, says Tharoor from 'elite class'
125.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said that Mallikarjun Kharge has the experience to strengthen the Congress and would emerge as a clear winner in the party presidential poll, while Shashi Tharoor belongs to the "elite class". "Kharge has a clean heart, he comes from the Dalit community...Tharoor is a class apart, he is from elite class," Gehlot said.

126.title: Traffic restrictions announced in parts of Mumbai for Durga idol immersions
126.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police issued traffic restrictions and directions that will be enforced across the city on October 5 and 6 for Durga idol immersions. As per the advisory, more than 20 key roads in the city, especially in South Mumbai and Eastern Suburbs, will be closed for normal vehicular movement and only vehicles carrying idols will be allowed.

127.title: Chinese billionaire settles allegation of raping 21-yr-old hours before trial in US
127.article_body: Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com's billionaire Founder Richard Liu agreed to settle a rape lawsuit less than 48 hours before a trial was set to begin in US. A former college student had accused Liu of raping her after a dinner with wealthy Chinese executives in 2018. She was 21 at the time and had attended the dinner as a volunteer.

128.title: There's no like-for-like replacement for Bumrah in world, leave alone India: Watson
128.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has said Jasprit Bumrah's absence will make it "all the more difficult" for India to win the 2022 T20 WC. "There's no like-for-like replacement for Bumrah in the world, leave alone India," stated Watson. Meanwhile, India coach Rahul Dravid has said they're waiting for the "official confirmation" on Bumrah being completely ruled out of the tournament.

129.title: Kerala LoP Satheesan extends support to Kharge in party polls
129.article_body: Kerala Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan extended his support to Mallikarjun Kharge for the Congress’ Presidential polls instead of Shashi Tharoor. "I have decided to support Mallikarjun Kharge. He is a very senior politician and a senior congressman...He belongs to the Dalit community. I am very happy that a Dalit leader will be elected President of the AICC," said Satheesan.

130.title: Maha govt order asks officials to say Vande Mataram instead of hello on calls from today
130.article_body: Maharashtra government on Saturday issued Government Resolution, making it mandatory for employees working in government and government-funded institutions to say ‘Vande Mataram’ instead of ‘hello’ while receiving phone calls from government officials and citizens. The campaign will be launched in Maharashtra on Sunday. Officials have also been asked to create awareness to use ‘Vande Mataram’.

131.title: Will repatriate illegal money from Swiss banks: Kejriwal in Gujarat
131.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal stated that those involved in "corruption" under the BJP government in Gujarat have parked their money in "Swiss banks" and his party will bring it back if it is voted to power in the state. The AAP national convenor has also promised the construction of 20,000 mohalla clinics on the lines of Delhi, across Gujarat.

132.title: UP CM pays floral tributes to Mahatma Gandhi, asks people to wear khadi
132.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath paid floral tributes to Mahatma Gandhi in Lucknow on the occasion of Mahatma's 153rd birth anniversary. "Gandhi ji had made an invaluable contribution to the independence of the country by uniting the people in the thread of unity...People must wear at least one khadi product," said the CM.

133.title: Unkind commentary never ends: Mahira on criticism for attending awards amid Pak floods
133.article_body: Actress Mahira Khan responded to a Twitter user after the latter criticised her for attending an award show in Canada amid Pakistan's floods and remarked that she would later donate her dresses. Mahira tweeted, "It's never ok for us...If it makes you happy, I can take some pictures while at it...But then it'll be...showing off doing charity...Unkind commentary never ends."

134.title: Bomb threat on IndiGo flight at Mumbai airport turns out to be a hoax
134.article_body: A threat email warning of a bomb on an IndiGo flight was received at Mumbai airport on Saturday, the Mumbai Police said. However, during the inspection of the flight, nothing was found in it, the Mumbai Police informed on Sunday. The IndiGo flight, which was scheduled to go to Ahmedabad from Mumbai, was delayed after the bomb threat.

135.title: Pained by Suzlon Founder's demise, he was a pioneering business leader: PM Modi
135.article_body: PM Narendra Modi condoled the demise of Suzlon Founder Tulsi Tanti who passed away at the age of 64 after suffering a cardiac arrest on Saturday. "Tanti was a pioneering business leader who contributed to India's economic progress and strengthened our nation's efforts to further sustainable development. Pained by his untimely demise," PM Modi wrote on Twitter.

136.title: Woman constable injured after falling off T'gana CM's convoy, video surfaces
136.article_body: A female constable fell out of a car that was moving in Telangana Chief Minister KCR's convoy. She sustained minor injuries, reports said. A video of incident was shared online. The incident took place during KCR's latest visit to Warangal. In the video, the constable can be seen falling off the car and then getting up and running after it.

137.title: PM Modi offers condolences to US Prez as 51 die due to Hurricane Ian
137.article_body: PM Narendra Modi offered his "sincere condolences and heartfelt sympathies" to United States President Joe Biden as the death toll due to Hurricane Ian rose to 51 in the country. Of the total deaths, 47 deaths were reported from Florida. "Our thoughts are with the people of the United States in these difficult times, " PM Modi added.

138.title: 51 killed in US due to Hurricane Ian, Biden to visit Florida on Wednesday
138.article_body: At least 51 people, 47 in Florida and four in North Carolina, have died due to Hurricane Ian. The Category 4 hurricane, one of the strongest to hit US, flooded roadways and damaged bridges. Nearly one million homes and businesses were without electricity on Saturday. US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden will travel to Florida on Wednesday.

139.title: PM Modi requested both Zelenskyy & Putin for ceasefire during evacuation: EAM
139.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar praised PM Modi for his leadership and stated that the PM had requested a ceasefire during the evacuation process from Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and Russian President Vladimir Putin. "PM used to hold back-to-back rallies in UP...and in the evening he used to take updates on the rescue operation," said Jaishankar.

140.title: Mourinho watches Roma's game from team bus after being banned in last game
140.article_body: Roma coach Jose Mourinho shared pictures of him watching his side's game against Inter Milan from their team bus parked outside the stadium. Notably, Mourinho was banned from being present during the game after he stormed onto the pitch and received a red card in their 0-1 defeat against Atalanta last month. Roma beat Inter Milan 2-1.

141.title: Aus criticises Optus for data leak that affected 40% population
141.article_body: The Australian government has criticised its second-biggest telecom firm, Optus, for a cybersecurity breach that affected 10 million accounts, almost 40% of the nation's population. "We should not be in the position we're in, but Optus has put us here," Home Minister Clare O'Neil told a news conference. An unidentified person said they released personal information of 10,000 Optus customers.

142.title: Flooding due to heavy rains leaves 8 dead in Venezuela; 3 missing
142.article_body: At least eight people died and three others are missing after heavy rainfall caused flooding in Venezuela, authorities said. The deceased were among a group of 10 people who were holding a gathering in Tachira and were swept away from an improvised camp, authorities added. Parts of Venezuela have been witnessing heavy rainfall for at least a week.

143.title: I'm not sure an average person can tell you what metaverse is: Apple CEO
143.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook in a recent interview said, "I'm...not sure the average person can tell you what the metaverse is." At the same time, he noted that virtual reality is "something you can really immerse yourself in". Cook added, "[It] can be used in a good way...But I don't think you want to live your whole life that way."

144.title: 25-yr-old stabbed '60 times' by 3 men as bystanders watch in Delhi; act caught on camera
144.article_body: A 25-year-old man identified as Manish died after he was allegedly stabbed 60 times by three men in Delhi's Sunder Nagri. A video of the incident showed the bystanders watching as the accused attacked Manish. Police said the motive of the murder seemed to be an old enmity and arrested three main suspects named Aalam, Bilal and Faizan.

145.title: India reports 3,375 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 37,444
145.article_body: India reported 3,375 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to data by Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 4,206 people recovered in the last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country stood at 37,444. This comes a day after the country recorded 3,805 fresh COVID-19 cases.

146.title: 40-60 startups to be sustainably profitable in 3 yrs: Bikhchandani
146.article_body: Info Edge Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani has said that 40 to 60 venture capital-funded tech startups in India would be sustainably profitable in the next three years. "It isn't all gloom and doom," he added. In April, the investor said that these days, it is desirable for highly educated and qualified people to aspire to take up entrepreneurship.

147.title: Hyd Police issues traffic diversion for CM KCR's visit to Gandhi Hospital
147.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police imposed traffic restrictions on roads near Gandhi Hospital as CM K Chandrashekar Rao will visit the hospital for Gandhi statue inauguration today. The traffic restriction will stay in place from 9 am to 1 pm. The police asked people to avoid roads surrounding Gandhi Hospital and suggested commuters to take alternate routes to reach their destinations.

148.title: 5G technology will transform every Indian's life: MoS IT
148.article_body: Union Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar on Saturday said that 5G technology will transform the life of every Indian. "The launch of 5G will have a lasting impact. It will be the future of the internet," Chandrasekhar added. "5G will bring a change to each person's life be it small businessmen, farmers, doctors or students," he stated.

149.title: New Zealand welcomes back indigenous remains stolen in 19th century
149.article_body: New Zealand's national museum, Te Papa, on Sunday welcomed back the remains of around 64 of the country's indigenous people, which were stolen in the 19th century, from Austria. The Maori and Moriori skeletal remains were "mostly taken by Austrian taxidermist and grave robber Andreas Reischek", the museum said. In July, a UK museum returned 113 remains to New Zealand.

150.title: Credit Suisse is at a critical moment: CEO to staff as shares near record-low
150.article_body: Credit Suisse CEO Ulrich Korner in a memo to his staff said that the bank is at a "critical moment" and asked them to not confuse the "day-to-day" stock price performance with the firm's "strong capital base and liquidity position". Notably, its shares are near record-low. "We're in the process of reshaping Credit Suisse for a long-term," added Korner.

151.title: India trying to give opportunities to all members of T20 WC squad: Karim
151.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has praised the Indian management for giving opportunities to all members of the T20 World Cup squad in the T20Is against South Africa and Australia. He added giving chances will keep the youngsters fit and in form for the World Cup. Notably, Deepak Chahar, who's part of the standbys, played in the first South Africa T20I.

152.title: Not seeking outstanding loan payment: Bankrupt crypto firm Celsius
152.article_body: US-based crypto lender Celsius Network has said it is not seeking payment of outstanding loans. In a filing at the US Bankruptcy Court, the firm mentioned that no interest or penalties will be assessed after loan maturity. In July, the fintech platform filed for bankruptcy with estimated assets and liabilities between $1 billion to $10 billion.

153.title: If I cover my head, why are Muslim girls being stopped: Sikh woman petitioner in hijab case
153.article_body: Charanjeet Kaur, a 46-year-old Sikh woman from Haryana, is the only non-Muslim petitioner among the 23 petitioners fighting against the Hijab ban in the Supreme Court. She said, "I can wear this turban...So why are the hijabi girls being stopped from wearing the hijab?" She added, "When there's fire in someone else's home, it can spread to our home too."

154.title: Kharge's confidence is good: Tharoor ahead of Cong Presidential poll
154.article_body: Ahead of Congress Presidential poll, party leader Shashi Tharoor on Saturday said that he stood for change and progress. "Mallikarjun Kharge's confidence is good. I am also confident that there are people who will listen to me too," Tharoor added. Party veteran Kharge and Tharoor are contesting the election, scheduled on October 17.

155.title: Bullet fired from ground pierces through plane mid-air, hits man in Myanmar
155.article_body: A Myanmar National Airlines plane passenger was shot mid-air after a bullet fired from the ground pierced through the plane's fuselage. The plane carrying 63 passengers was flying at an altitude of 3,500 feet and was about to land when it was hit, according to reports. A picture showed the victim holding a tissue to his neck and cheek.

156.title: Brighton hold Liverpool, Chelsea beat Crystal Palace in EPL
156.article_body: Liverpool were held to a 3-3 draw by Brighton as Leandro Trossard became the third player to score a hat-trick against Liverpool at the Anfield stadium in the English Premier League (EPL). Meanwhile, Chelsea secured their first win in the EPL under coach Graham Potter as they came from behind to beat Crystal Palace 2-1. Everton and Newcastle registered wins.

157.title: Woman RTO officer assaulted in Pune, bike rider booked
157.article_body: A bike taxi rider of an online aggregator company was booked by Pune police for physically assaulting a woman Assistant Regional Transport Officer in Vishrantwadi. The female officer sustained major injuries and was rushed to a private hospital for medical treatment. According to police, a squad of RTO officers was tracking an illegally operating bike taxi service in the city.

158.title: Old bridge in Pune's Chandani Chowk area demolished through controlled explosion
158.article_body: Edifice Engineering demolished an old bridge in the Chandani Chowk area of Pune in the early hours of Sunday through controlled explosion. Following the demolition, several earthmover machines and trucks were pressed into action to bring down the hanging structures and lift away the debris. A flyover will be constructed in its place to ease the traffic movement.

159.title: Have been sitting at home for last 4 years, not getting much work: Sajid Khan
159.article_body: Filmmaker Sajid Khan revealed that he has been sitting at home for the last four years and is not getting much work. Sajid, who is set to be a contestant in Bigg Boss' new season, said that he took up the offer to understand himself better. Earlier, several women had accused Sajid Khan of sexual misconduct during the #MeToo movement.

160.title: I said food was boring, Ranbir got me food next day; I started crying: Rashmika
160.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said that actor Ranbir Kapoor got her breakfast the day after she said that her food was boring. "I started crying. I am like 'How can the same food be so good? I am sorry but this is too good'. He is like, 'Why are you eating that boring food?'," she added.

161.title: NMMC plans to cut 194 trees in Navi Mumbai for flyover work
161.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) is planning to cut 194 trees to clear the way for a proposed flyover at the level crossing passing through Juinagar. The administration has identified around 300 trees obstructing the proposed flyover. According to NMMC, 194 trees are required to be axed and they are awaiting clearance from the tree authority.

162.title: Arrest warrant issued against Imran Khan for threatening judge
162.article_body: A court in Pakistan's Islamabad on Saturday issued an arrest warrant for the country's former PM Imran Khan for allegedly threatening a female judge at a rally in August. Last month, the court removed terror-related charges from the case. Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sana Ullah Khan told Geo News that the warrant was "routine and bailable".

163.title: Swing ride crashes at Ramlila event in Ghaziabad, 4 injured
163.article_body: Four people, including two children, were injured when a swing ride generally referred as 'break dance' swing crashed at Ghantaghar Ramlila Maidan in Ghaziabad on Friday. "One of the cabins suddenly got detached and fell off. Several people of a family sustained minor injuries but they did not lodge any police complaint," SHO Amit Kumar said.

164.title: 'Dream merchant' Kejriwal peddling lies during Guj poll campaign: Smriti Irani
164.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani called Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal a "dream merchant from Delhi" who is peddling "new dreams and lies" in Gujarat during campaigning for the upcoming polls. "He's visiting Gujarat with darkness but he must listen carefully that there is so much light of development in Gujarat that he will go blind," Irani added.

165.title: Neobanking crypto startup Juno raises $18 mn led by ParaFi Capital
165.article_body: Neobanking crypto startup Juno has secured $18 million in a Series A funding round led by ParaFi Capital's Growth Fund. The funding round saw participation from Abstract Ventures, 6th Man Ventures, Jump Crypto, Greycroft and Hashed, among others. In April 2020, the startup had raised $3 million in a seed funding round led by Sequoia India's accelerator programme, Surge.

166.title: 1GB data cost ₹300 in India earlier, it has now come down to ₹10 per GB: PM Modi
166.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during the launch event of 5G technology services in the country, said that 1GB data cost about ₹300 earlier. It has come down to about ₹10 per GB now, he stated. "On average, a person in India consumes 14GB (data) per month. This would have cost about ₹4,200 per month but costs ₹125-150," PM Modi added.

167.title: Amitabh is grumpiest, he says 'Have to go': Jaya on Big B around her friends
167.article_body: On a podcast with daughter Shweta Bachchan and granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda, Jaya Bachchan said that actor-husband Amitabh Bachchan is reserved around her friends. "Your nana is like, he is the grumpiest. He will say 'I have to go up, excuse me, ladies. If you don't mind'. Actually, they are quite happy that he is not there," she told Navya.

168.title: Only green firecrackers allowed in Chandigarh on Diwali from 8 pm to 10 pm
168.article_body: Chandigarh administration has allowed the sale and use of only green firecrackers that are certified by CSIR-NEERI. The administration has also said that the use of firecrackers would be allowed strictly from 8 pm to 10 pm on Diwali. An order by the administration said that the joined firecrackers, even if falling under the green category, have been banned.

169.title: Don't think India will make changes in batting unit for 2nd SA T20I: Jaffer
169.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said India are unlikely to make changes in their batting unit for the second South Africa T20I as the current top four are "going to be the same" for T20 World Cup in Australia. Jaffer, however, added that SA might drop Tristan Stubbs and open with Reeza Hendricks. The second T20I will be played today.

170.title: Musk to provide Starlink satellites to help Florida after hurricane
170.article_body: After Hurricane Ian hit US' Florida, the state Governor Ron DeSantis said on Saturday that SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has agreed to provide the company's satellite internet service, Starlink, to help parts of the state which have no connectivity. "[The company is] positioning those Starlink satellites to provide good coverage in Southwest Florida and other affected areas," he added.

171.title: Twitter user asks Musk his secret to staying healthy, he replies, 'Fasting'
171.article_body: A Twitter user while sharing Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s photo, asked him, ''What’s your secret? You look awesome, fit, ripped and healthy. Lifting weights? Eating healthy?'' To which Musk replied, ''Fasting.'' Replying to another user, Musk also said that he has been working out a little. The world's richest person recently revealed that he has been practising intermittent fasting.

172.title: PM Modi pays tribute to Mahatma Gandhi, Lal Bahadur Shastri on birth anniversaries
172.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti at Rajghat. "I…urge you all to purchase Khadi and handicrafts products as a tribute to Gandhi Ji," PM Modi tweeted. The Prime Minister also paid tribute to former PM Lal Bahadur Shastri on his birth anniversary at Vijay Ghat today.

173.title: Suzlon Founder Tulsi Tanti passes away aged 64 due to cardiac arrest
173.article_body: Tulsi Tanti, the Founder and Chairman of renewable energy company Suzlon Energy, passed away at the age of 64 after suffering from a cardiac arrest on Saturday, the company said. Tanti suffered a cardiac arrest soon after he landed in Pune while travelling from Ahmedabad, Times of India reported. He was reportedly in Ahmedabad to announce Suzlon's ₹1,200-crore rights issue.

174.title: Will hold back salary of BBMP engineers if encroachment removal delayed: HC
174.article_body: The Karnataka High Court warned Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) that if work of encroachment removal is delayed, the court may have to hold back salary of its engineers who are responsible for the demolition drives. The court further warned that an appropriate order will have to be issued against BBMP's Chief Commissioner if the work isn't completed on time.

175.title: 80-yr-old man, 75-yr-old wife die after fire due to AC in their Delhi house
175.article_body: An 80-year-old man and his 75-year-old wife were killed in a fire that broke out inside their house in Delhi. Police said that an air conditioner was the probable cause of the fire. "When police and fire service reached...they broke open the door and...found two persons unconscious...They shifted to Hedgewar Hospital where they were declared brought dead," the DCP said.

176.title: Video shows riot, massive stampede that killed 129 inside football stadium in Indonesia
176.article_body: A video surfaced online showing riot and massive stampede inside a football stadium in Indonesia that led to 129 deaths and at least 180 people getting injured.
