The disaster struck when police fired tear gas after Arema FC supporters invaded the pitch to express their frustration over loss against Persebaya Surabaya. In the video, police can be seen beating supporters.

177.title: Gandhis told me there is no 'official' candidate in Congress chief's election: Tharoor
177.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said he was told by the Gandhi family that there is no "official" candidate in the party President's election and they will stay neutral. He also suggested he will not withdraw from the poll race, saying he cannot betray his supporters. Tharoor and party veteran Mallikarjun Kharge are contesting the election, scheduled on October 17.

178.title: When we played same XI, people were saying, 'Why don't they change': Dravid
178.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid has said it's "unrealistic" to have the same playing XI in all the matches. Referring to Jasprit Bumrah's injury, Dravid added, "Some of the changes or experiments...are sometimes forced upon you." He further said, "We played the same XI...[vs SA in June]. People were saying, 'Why don't they change'...so, we can't win either way."

179.title: TSSPDCL official demands ₹30,000 bribe in Hyderabad; case filed
179.article_body: A case was filed after Anti-Corruption Bureau officials caught an assistant engineer, working at Southern Power Distribution Company of Telangana (TSSPDCL) Erragadda section, who demanded a ₹30,000 bribe on Saturday in Hyderabad. The complainant claimed that he approached the accused over a defect in the electricity meter, however, the latter demanded a bribe instead of taking action.

180.title: 31 new AC local trains start service in Mumbai division
180.article_body: As many as 31 more AC local trains started service between Mumbai division's Churchgate and Virar stations from Saturday. Earlier, Western Railway had 48 AC services between the two stations and with the latest addition, the number increased to 79. Some of the new AC trains have been introduced on new routes while some others replaced the existing non-AC services.

181.title: 1 killed as 4-storey building collapses in Navi Mumbai, rescue operations on
181.article_body: One person was killed after a four-storey building collapsed in Bonkode village in Kopar Khairane of Navi Mumbai. The incident took place at around 10.30 pm on Saturday.  Fire Officer, Purushottam Jadhav, said about 32 people who were staying in the building had moved out before it collapsed. Eight others were in process of moving out when the incident happened.

182.title: 129 people killed in stampede at football match after fans invade pitch in Indonesia
182.article_body: At least 129 people were killed and 180 injured at a football match in Indonesia after a stampede during a riot, police said on Sunday. After the match between Arema FC and Persebaya Surabaya ended on Saturday night, supporters from the losing team invaded the pitch and police fired tear gas, triggering a stampede and cases of suffocation, police stated.

183.title: Russian athletes who do not back invasion of Ukraine could return to competing: IOC
183.article_body: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) is considering a return to competition of Russian athletes who do not support the country's invasion of Ukraine, IOC president Thomas Bach said on Friday. "It is not about necessarily having Russia back. It's about having athletes with a Russian passport who do not support the war back in competition," Bach said.

184.title: Venezuela releases 7 jailed Americans in prisoner swap
184.article_body: Venezuela on Saturday freed seven jailed Americans, including five oil executives, in exchange for the release of two relatives of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, US officials said. The swap included executives of Citgo Petroleum held for years, in addition to US Marine veteran Matthew Heath and another American citizen named Osman Khan, the officials added.

185.title: Naman Ojha smashes 108* as India Legends beat SL Legends to win Road Safety World Series
185.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Naman Ojha smashed an unbeaten 108 off 71 deliveries as India Legends defeated Sri Lanka Legends in the final to win Road Safety World Series 2022. India Legends put up a total of 195/6 in their 20 overs and went on to dismiss Sri Lanka Legends for 162 in 18.5 overs. Vinay Kumar took three wickets for India Legends.

186.title: 5.9-magnitude earthquake hits Indonesia's Sumatra island, 1 killed
186.article_body: An earthquake measuring 5.9 magnitude hit Sumatra island in Indonesia on Saturday, killing one person and injuring 11 people. Over a dozen houses and buildings were damaged in the incident, police said. Two 5.0 magnitude aftershocks followed the main quake. Officials were investigating the full scale of the damage.

187.title: One of the Nord Stream pipelines has stopped leaking: Danish agency
187.article_body: The Danish Energy Agency on Saturday said one of the two Nord Stream gas pipelines, which had reported leakages recently, has stopped giving out gas. On Twitter, the agency said pressure appeared to have stabilised in the pipeline. "This indicates that the leaking of gas in this pipeline has ceased," the agency said.

188.title: Leave drones at nearby police stations: Police to Nashik residents
188.article_body: The Maharashtra Police in Nashik has ordered citizens to submit all drones to nearby police stations following two incidents of drones flying near defence establishments. Police said drones can now only be used with their permission and under their supervision by paying a fee. The order said even government-owned drones will be flown only after informing the nearby station.

189.title: 103-year-old voter felicitated by Election Dept in Himachal
189.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Electoral Officer Maneesh Garg felicitated a 103-year-old voter at the latter's residence in Chamba on International Day of Older Persons. Pyar Singh, who's the district icon for elections, has been casting his vote since 1952. All voters aged above 80 were honoured in the state with a citation signed by Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar.

190.title: JDS workers egg BJP MLC's car for not inviting Kumaraswamy to K'taka event
190.article_body: A clash erupted between JDS and BJP workers in Karnataka's Ramanagara district after JDS leader HD Kumaraswamy wasn't invited at the stone-laying ceremony of development projects. JDS workers also threw eggs at BJP MLC CP Yogeshwar's car, following which police detained them. "MLC went ahead with the...ceremony without informing me. I'll take the matter up with the Speaker," Kumaraswamy said.

191.title: Life-size Mahatma Gandhi hologram gives message on education at UN
191.article_body: A life-size Mahatma Gandhi hologram has delivered a message on education at the United Nations (UN). The session was part of an Ahinsa Lecture, themed 'Education for Human Flourishing'. A voice-over was played along with the hologram projection, sharing the thoughts of Mahatama Gandhi. The International Day of Non-Violence is observed on October 2, which is the leader's birth anniversary.

192.title: Narmada water to reach all over Kutch if AAP wins in Guj: Kejriwal
192.article_body: AAP's national convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal assured the people of Gujarat's Kutch that his party would "bring Narmada waters to every corner" within a year of forming the government. Kejriwal, accompanied by Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, further called the children of sitting ministers "useless". He also promised a school in every village and a hospital in every district.

193.title: Rajasthan Cong govt will complete full five-year term: CM Gehlot
193.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said the state's Congress government will complete its full five-year term and will not let the BJP topple it. "Earlier, too, the BJP tried horse trading but our MLAs were united," said Gehlot. Talking about the Congress President elections, Gehlot said "no one knew" when Rajnath Singh, Amit Shah and JP Nadda became BJP Presidents.

194.title: Raj Congress busy with political bickering: Rathore on Alwar rape
194.article_body: MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore said the Congress government in Rajasthan was busy with its political bickering and has no concern for the people. Talking about the alleged gangrape of a girl in Alwar, Rathore said state citizens were being "crushed" as Congress remained busy in its "power game". Criminals, extremists and separatists are emboldened due to appeasement politics, Rathore said.

195.title: Pitbull attacks 12 people across 5 villages in Punjab's Gurdaspur
195.article_body: A pitbull dog in Punjab's Gurdaspur attacked 12 people across five villages and was then killed by a retired army man and villagers in self-defence. The pitbull reportedly covered around 15 kilometres from Tango Shah village to Chuhan village, attacking people and animals on its way. The dog first attacked two labourers and then dragged a 60-year-old by his throat.

196.title: UP Police sends notice to 60 over CAA stir, seeks ₹57 lakh in damages
196.article_body: UP Police in Nahtaur has served notices to 60 people seeking ₹57 lakh in damages caused during the anti-CAA protests. Police said the mob allegedly damaged government property and set fire to a police jeep during the December 20, 2019, protests. They added that the mob attacked the police, who fired in self-defence, leading to two youths being killed.

197.title: Max could lose 2021 F1 championship over Red Bull cost cap trouble: Report
197.article_body: Red Bull F1 driver Max Verstappen could reportedly lose his 2021 world championship due to his team exceeding the year's cost cap. A report claims Red Bull exceeded the limit by $10 million, which makes it a major violation leading to points deduction or championship disqualification. "Many teams don't even have that much budget for mid-season upgrades," said the report.

198.title: 5 kg heroin recovered in J&K's Poonch district; 1 arrested
198.article_body: Punjab Police and Jammu & Kashmir (J&K) Police carried out a joint raid in J&K's Poonch district on Saturday and recovered five kilograms of heroin worth crores of rupees, officials said. A suspected drug peddler was also arrested during the raid, as per the officials. The consignment is believed to have been smuggled from across the border, officials added.

199.title: Mikel Arteta doesn't give Arsenal players much freedom: Cesc Fabregas
199.article_body: Former Arsenal FC captain Cesc Fabregas said current manager Mikel Arteta doesn't give Arsenal players the same freedom he enjoyed. "Mikel now is a little bit of 'it's his way'...it's about the way he wants the approach to be from himself, not the players," said Fabregas. Arsenal beat Tottenham Hotspur 3-1 on Saturday to stay top of the league.

200.title: Instagram introduces 'Notes' that vanish in 24 hours, Twitter users react
200.article_body: Instagram has introduced a new feature called 'Notes' which are visible to a user's followers in the DM section for 24 hours and have a 60-character limit. Followers can also respond to 'Notes'. "Instagram notes is going to be the new source of sliding in DMs," said a Twitter user. "Instagram notes...are as useless as the GPay rewards," said another.

201.title: We'll know in due course: Dravid on whether Jasprit Bumrah will play T20 World Cup 2022
201.article_body: Talking about whether Jasprit Bumrah will play T20 World Cup 2022, Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said, "He is being assessed and we'll know in due course." Dravid added, "Till he is completely ruled out till I get official confirmation that he is ruled out, we will always be hopeful. We will always hope for the best."

202.title: Haaland now fully recovered from last year's injury: Man City coach
202.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola revealed that forward Erling Haaland was struggling after surgery for his hip flexor muscle injury but has now fully recovered. "Thanks to them (physios), and of course his work ethic, he can play regularly, which last season wasn't possible," said Guardiola. Club physio Mario Pafundi travelled with the Norwegian striker during the international break.

203.title: 5G will help Uttar Pradesh become 1 trillion dollar economy: CM Yogi
203.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said 5G will lead to a qualitative improvement in the pace of work and will help the state become a one trillion dollar economy. PM Narendra Modi has started a new era of communication revolution in the country, Adityanath said. His comment comes after PM Modi launched 5G services at India Mobile Congress on Saturday.

204.title: Palestinian teenager shot dead by Israeli forces in West Bank
204.article_body: A Palestinian teenager was reportedly shot dead by Israeli forces on Saturday in the West Bank after a group of youths smashed a hole through the Israeli separation barrier and began throwing objects at police. A protester who attempted to throw a firebomb at Israeli troops was shot, border police said. Palestinian officials identified the deceased as 18-year-old Fayez Damdoum.

205.title: Iranian woman arrested for eating at restaurant without hijab, says her family
205.article_body: An Iranian woman was arrested after a picture showed her eating at a restaurant without her hijab (headscarf), her family has said. The woman Donya Rad was summoned by authorities and then arrested, CNN reported quoting her sister. Iran has seen widespread civil unrest after a 22-year-old woman was killed in police custody after being arrested for her 'improper hijab'.

206.title: Jeswin wins National Games long jump gold, qualifies for World C'ships 2023
206.article_body: Long jumper Jeswin Aldrin qualified for 2023 World Athletics Championships after he won the gold medal following his 8.26-metre jump at 36th National Games in Gujarat on Saturday. The 20-year-old long jumper's winning jump measured 0.1m above the automatic World Championships 2023 qualifying standard of 8.25m. CWG 2022 silver medallist Murali Sreeshankar won silver with a jump of 7.93m.

207.title: India winning T20 World Cup depends on Suryakumar Yadav: Brad Hogg
207.article_body: Former Australian bowler Brad Hogg said India's success in the 2022 T20 World Cup depends on Suryakumar Yadav's performance. "He is the most important player in the team as he is creative and inventive," said Hogg. He added that if India losses its top order early, then Suryakumar "sums up the situation" to give India the best chance to win.

208.title: Salman said 'get lost' when he was offered money for cameo in 'GodFather': Chiranjeevi
208.article_body: In an interview with Film Companion, Chiranjeevi revealed that Salman Khan agreed to appear in the upcoming movie 'GodFather' without reading a script and refused to take payment for his cameo. "When my producers went to him and offered him some amount...he said, 'You cannot buy my love towards Ram [Charan] and Chiranjeevi garu with money. Get lost'," Chiranjeevi added.

209.title: Drone captures footage of Mount Everest, Twitter users call it 'breathtaking'
209.article_body: Industrialist Harsh Goenka took to Twitter to share a video that shows drone footage of the view of Mount Everest, world's highest mountain. The video, posted on the official YouTube channel of tech company DJI, also gives a glimpse of some mountaineers. Some Twitter users called it "breathtaking" while other comments read, "Spectacular visuals" and "Mesmerising view".

210.title: Video of controversial run-out of India's Pooja Vastrakar goes viral, fans react
210.article_body: A video of India Women's Pooja Vastrakar's controversial run-out in the match against Sri Lanka in Asia Cup went viral. Pooja was declared out despite replays seemingly showing she was inside her crease. "How on earth is Pooja given out by...third umpire?" a fan wrote. "That is such a poor decision by the third umpire," tweeted Yuvraj Singh.

211.title: UP govt school vaccinates kids without consent, many ill: Parents
211.article_body: Around 50 students were taken to a hospital after being administered DPT vaccine at a government primary school in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh. Parents said children were locked in school and vaccinated without their parents' consent, adding that many fell ill post-vaccination. Chief Medical Officer Neeraj Tyagi said children weren't seriously ill but had suffered from routine reactions from the dose.

212.title: Over 30,000 dengue cases reported in Pakistan this year
212.article_body: As many as 30,267 cases of dengue have been reported in Pakistan this year, as of Saturday. The country's capital, Islamabad, has reportedly logged 2,435 cases thus far. The nationwide death toll due to the viral infection has reached 68. The surge in dengue cases comes in the wake of devastating floods that continue to affect several parts of Pakistan.

213.title: 23.28 lakh Indian accounts banned by WhatsApp in August
213.article_body: WhatsApp on Saturday said that it banned 23.28 lakh Indian accounts in the month of August. Of these, 10,08,000 were proactively banned, before any reports from users, WhatsApp stated. According to WhatsApp's latest report, 598 grievance reports were received, and 19 accounts were "actioned" in August. Of the total reports received, 449 pertained to 'ban appeal'.

214.title: Federer raised tennis to a higher level like Woods did with golf: Almagro
214.article_body: Ex-tennis player Nicolas Almagro has said Roger Federer's retirement is a significant loss for everything that has changed tennis since his arrival. "He raised it to a higher level as Tiger Woods did with golf or Michael Jordan with basketball," he added. "Hopefully the next generations will remain faithful to the legacy that he [Federer] leaves," he further said.

215.title: Prashant Kishor to begin 3,500-km 'padyatra' in Bihar tomorrow
215.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor will start his 3,500-km 'padyatra' on the occasion of Mahatma Gandhi's birth anniversary on Sunday from Bihar's West Champaran district. Kishor's 'padyatra' is part of his 'Jan Suraj' campaign and is expected to last for 12 to 18 months. Kishor joined the JD(U) in 2018 and was expelled from the party in 2020.

216.title: PM Modi visits ex-President Kovind on latter's 77th birthday
216.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met former President Ram Nath Kovind at the latter's residence in New Delhi on Saturday, on the occasion of Kovind's 77th birthday. Earlier, PM Modi tweeted, "Birthday greetings to Shri Ram Nath Kovind Ji. He is widely respected for his statesmanship and leadership." PM also tweeted photographs of the meeting with Kovind, his wife and daughter.

217.title: Over 20 killed as vehicle with pilgrims overturns in UP, PM expresses condolences
217.article_body: At least 22 people died and several others were injured as a vehicle carrying pilgrims met with an accident in UP's Kanpur on Saturday. The tractor trolley with dozens of pilgrims who were returning from Unnao overturned in the Ghatampur area. PM Narendra Modi condoled the deaths and announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh for families of the deceased.

218.title: Ex-Kerala Home Minister Kodiyeri Balakrishnan passes away at 68
218.article_body: Former Kerala Home Minister Kodiyeri Balakrishnan passed away in Chennai on Saturday at the age of 68. The veteran CPI(M) leader was diagnosed with cancer earlier and had been under treatment at Apollo Hospital. He had stepped down as party state Secretary in August due to poor health. He served as Kerala Home Minister from 2006-2011.

219.title: Once auditioned for 'Indian Idol' but wasn't selected: Kapil Sharma
219.article_body: Actor-comedian Kapil Sharma has revealed that he once auditioned for the singing reality show 'Indian Idol'. However, he wasn't selected. "Then there was this 'Indian Idol' copy 'Awaz Punjab Di' in our area where I was selected. During that very time, I also got selected for 'The Laughter Challenge'. However, I'd self-analysed and...I finally chose 'The Laughter Challenge'," said Kapil.

220.title: Ghulam Nabi Azad elected chairman of Democratic Azad Party
220.article_body: Ghulam Nabi Azad, former Chief Minister of the erstwhile state of Jammu and Kashmir, has been elected the chairman of the newly-formed Democratic Azad Party (DAP), said a party leader on Saturday. A resolution was passed unanimously at a founder members' session, said the leader. Azad, 73, quit Congress on August 26 this year.

221.title: Haridwar ranked cleanest Ganga town with population above 1 lakh
221.article_body: Haridwar has been adjudged the cleanest town along the Ganga river in the category of more than one lakh population in the Centre's latest Swachh Survekshan survey. Varanasi and Rishikesh were ranked second and third respectively. Meanwhile, Bijnor bagged the first position among Ganga towns with fewer than one lakh population. The survey focused on "cleanliness in and around Ghats".

222.title: Ex-Delhi Capitals spinner Lamichhane to surrender in rape case, says 'I am innocent'
222.article_body: Former Nepal captain and former Delhi Capitals spinner Sandeep Lamichhane has said that he will go to Nepal on October 6 and surrender himself to the authorities in a rape case of 17-year-old girl. Calling allegations against him "false", Lamichhane said, "I hereby reiterate that I am INNOCENT and I have complete non-shaken faith in justice system."

223.title: Our neighbour is an expert in 'Int'nl Terrorists', we're experts in IT: Jaishankar
223.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Saturday said that India has a neighbour who is an expert in "international terrorists" just like we're experts in information technology (IT). "We were able to make the world understand that terrorism isn't political or diplomatic," said Jaishankar. "Today it's being done against us, tomorrow it will be done against you," he added.

224.title: Nimrat attends inaugural ceremony of late father Major Bhupender's statue
224.article_body: Actress Nimrat Kaur recently travelled to Patiala for the inaugural ceremony of her late father Major Bhupender Singh's statue in Patiala regiment. A bronze statue of Major Bhupender Singh was inaugurated at the Heritage Hall at his parent regiment 64 Assault Engineer Regiment in Patiala. "It's a really special moment for us...to be here to honour his memory," Nimrat said.

225.title: Run-outs cost us the match: SL skipper Athapaththu on 41-run loss vs India
225.article_body: Sri Lanka Captain Chamari Athapaththu said the run-outs in the crucial times cost her side the match against India in Women's Asia Cup. "In the death overs, there was good bowling...The run-outs are an issue, we need to concentrate on overcoming it," she added. Sri Lanka lost by 41 runs after being bowled out for 109 in 18.2 overs.

226.title: Harshal is mentally strong, he bowled a fantastic last over vs SA: Dravid
226.article_body: Backing Harshal Patel following his comeback to the Indian team after a rib injury, India head coach Rahul Dravid stated the pacer is mentally strong and he bowled brilliantly in the last over in first T20I against South Africa. Harshal, who was ruled out of Asia Cup 2022, returned to the squad for three-match T20I series against Australia.

227.title: Himachal CM inaugurates art & craft culture centre 'Dev Lok' in Kullu
227.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Saturday inaugurated the art and craft culture centre 'Dev Lok' in Kullu district's Baragran Bihal, which has been constructed in PPP mode at a cost of ₹46 crore. The local artists and artisans would also get an opportunity to promote, exhibit and market their products through this unique centre, Jairam Thakur said.

228.title: List measures against police procuring vehicles illegally: HC to Meghalaya
228.article_body: The Meghalaya High Court (HC) has asked the state's Home Secretary to submit a report on the steps that have been taken against police department officials who allegedly procured vehicles illegally. "Such (a) report should be filed when the matter appears next on October 17," the court said. The HC further asked if any arrests were made in the matter.

229.title: PM Modi is not following my advice to give brotherhood message: CM Gehlot
229.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that PM Narendra Modi is not following his "advice" to give the message of "brotherhood" to the public. "We lost as voters swayed away under the 'Modi wave'. We (Congress) were winning Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh and Rajasthan [in the 2019 general elections]...I request people to give us another chance," he said.

230.title: I would watch out for Rishabh Pant in 2nd T20I against SA: Nehra
230.article_body: Ex-Indian pacer Ashish Nehra said that he would "watch out" for wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant in the second T20I against South Africa in Guwahati on Sunday. "He (Pant) is bound to be in the playing XI now, he has a good chance with Hardik Pandya not being there...Now if he also scores runs, that will be another plus point," Nehra said.

231.title: 42-year-old man's body found buried in friend's house in Kerala
231.article_body: A 42-year-old man, who went missing last week, was found dead and buried in the house of his friend in Changanassery in Kottayam, Kerala. The body of the deceased, Bindumon, was found in a concrete-filled place of the house, police said. The house belonged to Bindumon's friend, Muthukumar, who is also missing since Friday, police added.

232.title: Comfortable with what we've got: Dravid on India's potential XI for T20 WC
232.article_body: Talking about Team India's potential playing XI for T20 World Cup, head coach Rahul Dravid said he and the team management have been pretty clear with the kind of skills they want in the players. "You can't pick them many months in advance, you won't know what we'll get...I think we are quite comfortable with what we have," he added.

233.title: Attack in Iran kills 19 including top Revolutionary Guard official
233.article_body: An attack on a police station by armed separatists on Friday killed 19 people, including four members of Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps, state media reported. The head of the Revolutionary Guard's intelligence department was also injured in the attack and died later, state media reports said. Nearly 32 members of the corps were reportedly wounded in the clashes.

234.title: 28 Iranian journalists arrested since start of Amini protests: CPJ
234.article_body: At least 28 Iranian journalists and photographers have been arrested since the anti-regime protests started in the country two weeks ago, the Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ) has said. The demonstrations began following the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini allegedly in police custody. Amini was arrested over her 'improper hijab'.

235.title: Salary hike order for Gadchiroli police to be issued in 2 days: Fadnavis
235.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said that an order increasing the salaries of police personnel posted in the Naxal-affected Gadchiroli district would be issued within two days. Fadnavis held a meeting of the District Planning Committee in Gadchiroli and said the decision on increasing the salaries of police personnel in the district one-and-half times was pending.

236.title: Nick Cannon becomes father for 10th time, welcomes his 3rd baby with Brittany Bell
236.article_body: Actor Nick Cannon took to social media to announce that he has welcomed his 10th child, his third baby with model Brittany Bell. "Thank you Brittany for my fellow little Libra! I love you and our incredible family!" he wrote on Instagram, sharing a video. Two weeks ago, Cannon had welcomed his ninth child, his first with photographer LaNisha Cole.

237.title: We are happy: Harmanpreet on India's 41-run win vs SL in Women's Asia Cup
237.article_body: After India's 41-run win against Sri Lanka in Women's Asia Cup, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said her side didn't start off well. "But those crucial run-outs and we kept getting wickets. We are happy as few of our bowlers stood up, especially Deepti Sharma. After losing crucial wickets, Jemimah Rodrigues played really well," she added. Jemimah top-scored in the match.

238.title: Russian troops flee city in annexed Ukrainian region as Ukraine army surrounds them
238.article_body: Russia on Saturday said its troops had withdrawn from the key city of Lyman, located in Ukraine's Donetsk region, which was annexed by Russia recently. Russian troops fled after Ukraine's army "encircled" the city which lies 160 kilometres southeast of Kharkiv- Ukraine's second-largest city. This came a day after Russian President Vladimir Putin announced the annexation of four Ukrainian regions.

239.title: J&K administration has been a 'complete failure': NC leader
239.article_body: Provincial President of National Conference for Jammu Rattan Lal Gupta on Saturday said the Jammu and Kashmir administration has been a "complete failure". "The LG's administration has turned out to be a dummy government...with no powers of its own as...instructions are being broadcasted from New Delhi," Gupta said. He criticised the administration for not doing enough for the people.

240.title: People want to go to Hollywood, I want to go to South: Salman
240.article_body: Salman Khan, who'll make his Telugu film debut with a cameo in 'GodFather', said while many people aspire to do Hollywood films, he wants to do South films. "We say ₹300 crore, ₹400 crore. If all of us get together, we can cross ₹3,000-4,000 crore," he added. "Everyone just grows and grows and the numbers become really large," Salman stated.

241.title: Actor Annu Kapoor cheated of ₹4.36 lakh in online KYC fraud
241.article_body: Actor Annu Kapoor lost ₹4.36 lakh to an online fraudster on the pretext of getting his Know Your Customer (KYC) details updated with a leading private sector bank. The bank immediately called Annu to inform about the fraudulent transactions and told him his account was compromised. The accounts where the money was sent have been frozen.

242.title: Ben Stokes responds to Bhogle's criticism of England over Deepti Sharma controversy
242.article_body: England's Ben Stokes took to Twitter to respond to commentator Harsha Bhogle's criticism of England for targeting Deepti Sharma over mankading. Reacting to Bhogle calling it a "cultural thing", Stokes wrote, "Harsha...2019 WC final was over 2 years ago, I still till this day revive countless messages calling me all sorts from Indian fans, does this disturb you?"

243.title: 20 killed in Russian shelling of humanitarian convoy: Ukraine
243.article_body: Russian shelling hit a civilian evacuation convoy in Ukraine's Kharkiv region on Saturday, killing at least 20 people, a Ukrainian official said. It was the second Russian attack on a humanitarian convoy in two days, as per Ukrainian claims. Russian forces have reportedly withdrawn from most of Kharkiv since Ukraine mounted a counter-offensive in the region last month.

244.title: Arsenal beat 10-man Tottenham in north London derby to remain top of PL table
244.article_body: Arsenal moved four points clear at the top of the Premier League table after a 3-1 win over 10-man Tottenham Hotspur in north London derby at Emirates Stadium on Saturday. Arsenal have seven wins from eight league games this season. Thomas Partey(20'), Gabriel Jesus(49') and Granit Xhaka(67') netted for Arsenal, while Harry Kane(31') scored a penalty for Tottenham.

245.title: Man gets ₹22 lakh estimate to repair car that cost him ₹11 lakh in Bengaluru, post viral
245.article_body: A Bengaluru man claimed he was handed ₹22 lakh estimate to repair his Volkswagen car worth ₹11 lakh. He said the servicing centre charged him ₹44,840 for insurance paperwork before he could collect his car. When he contacted Volkswagen India, he was informed the charge is only ₹5,000. He stated that he finally got his car back on September 26.

246.title: It's better now: Malaika on equation with ex-husband Arbaaz Khan
246.article_body: Malaika Arora, on being asked if she continues to be friends with ex-husband Arbaaz Khan, said, "We have a better equation now." "We are far more mature. We're just happier, calmer people," she added. Calling Arbaaz a wonderful man, Malaika said, "Sometimes, people are wonderful but they just aren't great together. That's just how it is."

247.title: Wide-ranging measures will be invoked if N Korea tests nukes: US
247.article_body: The US will invoke measures spanning "multiple instruments of national power" in case North Korea conducts a nuclear test, officials with the US Indo-Pacific Command said on Friday. This came a day before North Korea conducted its fourth ballistic missile launch this week. US and South Korean officials believe that a test is likely between October 16 and November 7.

248.title: 30 ill after eating hostel food in Kota, 1 saw 'lizard in curry'
248.article_body: At least 30 girl students complained about vomiting and dizziness after eating the food served at their hostel in Rajasthan's Kota on Thursday. A student claimed she had noticed a lizard in the curry. Chief Medical Health Officer Jagdish Soni said the food was thrown out before samples could be collected for examination. He added that a probe is underway.

249.title: People should stop asking such questions: Salman on if Bigg Boss is scripted
249.article_body: Ahead of the premiere of 'Bigg Boss 16', Salman Khan opened up about the allegations that the show is scripted. "This show is [not] scripted...It would be better if people stop asking such questions," he said. "You cannot script a show like Bigg Boss. No writer in this world can write a show like Bigg Boss," Salman added.

250.title: India, South Africa would be the teams to watch out for in T20 WC: Kallis
250.article_body: Ex-Proteas all-rounder Jacques Kallis said that India and South Africa would be the teams to watch out for in the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. "It will be an important series in India now between these two teams even though the conditions would be different," Kallis said. He added, "It will be a good WC for South Africa."

251.title: Which states are the cleanest in India as per the latest Swachh Bharat survey?
251.article_body: Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh and Maharashtra have been adjudged the first, second and third cleanest Indian states respectively by the latest Swachh Bharat survey, findings of which were released on Saturday. Tripura bagged the top rank in the category of states with less than 100 urban local bodies. This is the seventh edition of the cleanliness survey which began in 2016.

252.title: Unmukt Chand suffers serious eye injury, shares pics
252.article_body: India's 2012 Under-19 World Cup-winning captain Unmukt Chand, who plays in US' Minor League Cricket, suffered a serious eye injury while playing. He took to Twitter to share pictures, writing, "It's never a smooth ride for an athlete. Some days you come home victorious, other days disappointed & there are some when you come home with bruises and dents."

253.title: How does T20 World Cup's prize money compare with that of IPL and other leagues?
253.article_body: The winners of the men's T20 World Cup 2022 will get a prize money of ₹13.02 crore. The Indian Premier League (IPL) 2022 winners received a prize money of ₹20 crore. The winners of Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2022 got ₹3.40 crore, while Big Bash League (BBL) 2021-22 winners received ₹3.66 crore.

254.title: Wicket in Sylhet was tricky: Jemimah on her 53-ball 76 in Women's Asia Cup
254.article_body: After being adjudged 'Player of the Match' against Sri Lanka in Women's Asia Cup, India batter Jemimah Rodrigues said the wicket in Sylhet was tricky. "Initially it was not turning, but then it turned. I had prepared well for this, even in Bengaluru I asked for slower...turning wickets," she added. Jemimah top-scored in the match with her 53-ball 76.

255.title: Turkey rejects Russia's annexation of Ukrainian regions
255.article_body: Turkey on Saturday denounced Russia's annexation of four regions in Ukraine, saying that the move is a "grave violation" of international law. Russian President Vladimir Putin announced the formal annexation of Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia on Friday after "referendums" were held by Moscow-backed authorities there. The annexed regions account for about 15% of Ukrainian territory.

256.title: Many areas in Pune waterlogged after intense rain on Friday
256.article_body: Many areas in Pune were waterlogged after brief but intense spells of rain on Friday. From 4 pm to 6 pm on Friday, Shivajinagar received 35.1 mm of rain, Pashan received 7.2 mm of rain and Lohegaon received 9.2 mm of rain, the India Meteorological Department said. The rains caused traffic congestion and incidents of trees falling.

257.title: It will be good battle between Stokes, Pandya in T20 WC: Kallis
257.article_body: Former South African cricketer Jacques Kallis said that there will be a "good battle" between all-rounders, Hardik Pandya and Ben Stokes, in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "These two (Pandya-Stokes) are world-class all-rounders," Kallis said. He added, "All-rounders are something you need to look after [as] they don't come around often...Both of them will play a big role."

258.title: Amit Shah to embark on 2-day J&K visit from Oct 4, to review security situation
258.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will visit Jammu and Kashmir for two days from October 4, during which he will review the security situation at a meeting to be held in Srinagar. He is also scheduled to address two rallies and offer prayers at Vaishno Devi temple. Shah will also lay foundation stones for several developmental projects in Jammu.

259.title: Where are your promises for Telangana?: KTR questions Centre
259.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Saturday demanded an explanation from the Centre for not fulfilling the promises made to people of Telangana. "It's a shame that not a single promise made in...AP Reorganisation Act has been kept either for Telangana or...Andhra Pradesh," KTR tweeted. He also accused Union Minister G Kishan Reddy of fooling the citizens of Telangana.

260.title: Army Captain among 3 injured in road accident in UP's Saharanpur
260.article_body: Three people, including an Army Captain, were injured after the car in which they were travelling collided with a stationary truck on a state highway in Deoband in UP's Saharanpur district. The injured, Army Captain Rohan Singh, Satyendra and Shyamsundar, were taken to a local hospital, police said. Notably, the car was going from Delhi to Punjab.

261.title: PMC's demand for more water is natural: Ajit Pawar
261.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party leader Ajit Pawar has supported the Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) demand for more water. The PMC has asked for approval of 20.34 thousand million cubic (TMC) feet of water for the city from the Water Resources Department. "As the population has risen, it is natural to demand more water," Pawar said.

262.title: Interfaith couple assaulted by 2 men in Bengaluru Rural district
262.article_body: An interfaith couple was allegedly assaulted by two men in Doddabalpur in Karnataka's Bengaluru Rural district. The accused, Akbar and Hujur, were booked and later, Akbar has been arrested, police said. The complaint has been registered based on a video of the incident where Hujur can be seen slapping the woman. Notably, Akbar is an electrician and recording the video.

263.title: 5G rollout will benefit education sector in a big way: Union Minister
263.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Saturday said the rollout of 5G technology in the country will benefit education in a big way. The launch of 5G telecom services will greatly help in the implementation of 'digital university' being envisioned by Education Ministry, Pradhan said. "5G will be the major vehicle to reach out to the unreachable," he added.

264.title: How does T20 World Cup's prize money compare with that of IPL and other leagues?
264.article_body: The winners of the men's T20 World Cup 2022 will get a prize money of ₹13.02 crore. The Indian Premier League (IPL) 2022 winners received a prize money of ₹20 crore. The winners of Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2022 got ₹3.40 crore, while Big Bash League (BBL) 2021-22 winners received ₹3.66 crore.

265.title: Unmukt Chand suffers serious eye injury, shares pics
265.article_body: India's 2012 Under-19 World Cup-winning captain Unmukt Chand, who plays in US' Minor League Cricket, suffered a serious eye injury while playing. He took to Twitter to share pictures, writing, "It's never a smooth ride for an athlete. Some days you come home victorious, other days disappointed & there are some when you come home with bruises and dents."

266.title: Child dies as bus crashes into car on Bengaluru-Mysuru highway
266.article_body: A child died on the spot after a speeding bus crashed into a car on Bengaluru-Mysuru highway near Channapatna, Mysuru MP Pratap Simha said on Saturday. "#SpeedKills," he tweeted. The accident involved a travel company's bus and six other cars. The bus reportedly rammed into a car, which in turn crashed into the car in front of it.

267.title: It changed my life, made a star out of dust: Jackie on 'Hero'
267.article_body: Actor Jackie Shroff, when asked about a film that changed his life, named 'Hero'. "[It] put me here from chawl. It made a star out of the dust," he added. The film, which was released in 1983, was directed by Subhash Ghai. The action-drama film also starred Sanjeev Kumar, Shammi Kapoor and Amrish Puri, among others.

268.title: PCMC postpones deadline to stop wet garbage collection from societies
268.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) said it has postponed its decision to not pick wet garbage from big housing societies starting October 2. PCMC said it would give the housing societies a month's time, till October 31, to find a solution. This comes after residential housing societies in PCMC jurisdiction threatened to dump wet garbage outside the civic headquarters.

269.title: List of cleanest Indian cities released, Indore bags top spot for the 6th time
269.article_body: MP's Indore has been ranked as the cleanest city in India by the Centre's Swachh Survekshan survey, for the sixth consecutive time. Surat in Gujarat and Navi Mumbai in Maharashtra occupy the second and third spots in the latest ranking. Visakhapatnam and Vijayawada in Andhra Pradesh have been ranked fourth and fifth cleanest cities, respectively.

270.title: 'Pushpa' changed perception of me as an actor across the country: Rashmika
270.article_body: Rashmika Mandanna said in an interview that 'Pushpa: The Rise' changed the perception of her as an actor across the country. "I was never an actor. I am still in a phase where I am exploring myself. So for me, being a public figure is still a new concept," she added. Directed by Sukumar, the film also featured Allu Arjun.

271.title: 3 arrested for child pornography on Twitter: DCW Chairperson
271.article_body: Chairperson of Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) Swati Maliwal said the police have arrested three persons in connection with child pornography content being available on Twitter. The DCW said Maliwal wrote to the Director of the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) about the matter. The statement added eight Delhi Police teams conducted nationwide raids as part of the investigation.

272.title: Final pre-demolition work on Pune's Chandani Chowk bridge completed
272.article_body: The final pre-demolition work, including the drilling of explosives and putting up of sign boards, on Pune's Chandani Chowk old bridge has been completed by the NHAI. There will be a traffic block of nine hours from 11 pm on October 1 to 8 am on October 2. Union Minister Nitin Gadkari earlier did an aerial review of the work.

273.title: 'Mr Putin, don't misunderstand what I'm saying,' warns Biden amid Ukraine war
273.article_body: As US imposed wide-ranging sanctions on Russia over its declared annexation of parts of Ukraine, President Joe Biden warned Russian President Vladimir Putin against making any threat to NATO territory. "America's fully prepared with our NATO allies to defend every single inch of NATO territory," Biden said. "So Mr Putin, don't misunderstand what I'm saying. Every inch," he stated.

274.title: Use drones to conduct geospatial mapping of Delhi: SC to Centre
274.article_body: The Supreme Court has directed the Centre to use drones to conduct the geospatial mapping of Delhi. An apex court bench of Justices AS Oka and Sanjay Kishan Kaul said geospatial mapping would help in digitising land records and checking encroachments. “This is what we had done in Chennai when I was the Chief Justice there,” Justice Kaul said.

275.title: Jemimah top-scores as India beat SL in their 1st match of Women's Asia Cup
275.article_body: India Women beat Sri Lanka Women by 41 runs in their opening match of the Women's Asia Cup 2022 in Bangladesh on Saturday. After being put to bat first, India scored 150/6 in 20 overs. In reply, Sri Lanka were all out for 109 in 18.2 overs. With a 53-ball 76, India batter Jemimah Rodrigues top-scored in the match.

276.title: Teacher stabs wife to death in front of 9-yr-old daughter in Delhi
276.article_body: A government school teacher allegedly stabbed and killed his wife in front of their nine-year-old daughter following an argument in southwest Delhi's Nawada on Friday, police said. The daughter told police that her father stabbed her mother with a knife, a senior official informed. The accused was missing when police found his wife's body at the couple's house, police added.

277.title: Health profile of every citizen of T'gana will be prepared soon: KCR
277.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday said the health profile of every citizen of Telangana will be prepared soon. The initiative launched on a pilot basis in Sircilla and Mulugu has concluded, he added. Speaking after the inauguration of Prathima Cancer Hospital in Warangal, Rao said, "Details such as blood group and other parameters of every person...[will be] computerised."

278.title: Hyderabad airport issues travel advisory for festive season
278.article_body: Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport issued a traffic advisory as the number of passengers is expected to surge during the festive season. It requested those travelling out of Hyderabad to reach the airport well in advance. "A longer wait time for transportation facilities from the airport to the city is expected. Passengers can avail...transportation available at the airport," it added.

279.title: Man given 142-year jail sentence for raping minor girl for 2 years in Kerala
279.article_body: A 41-year-old man in Kerala's Pathanamthitta was sentenced to 142 years of rigorous imprisonment for raping a minor girl for two years from 2019 to 2021. The court said that this was the maximum punishment awarded to an accused under POCSO Act by it, adding that the man will undergo 60 years of imprisonment. He's also been fined ₹5 lakh.

280.title: BSP MLA booked as Damoh Collector says she 'abused, threatened' him
280.article_body: The Collector of Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district has accused Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) woman MLA Rambai Parihar of abusing and threatening him. Police have registered an FIR based on S Krishna Chaitanya's complaint. Parihar allegedly misbehaved with Chaitanya and used obscene words against him when she and some other women met him regarding grievances over a local issue on Friday.

281.title: 2 chain snatchers held in Hyd, valuables worth ₹2.5 lakh recovered
281.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested two chain snatchers and recovered 30 grams of gold ornaments, a motorcycle and two smartphones, all worth ₹2.5 lakh from the accused. The accused were identified as 38-year-old Pulipati Kiran and 20-year-old Siddamoni Narender. The arrests were made after a woman complained that two bike-borne miscreants snatched her gold chain and escaped.

282.title: Olympian fencer Bhavani completes hattrick of gold medals at National Games
282.article_body: Olympian fencer Bhavani Devi won her third consecutive gold medal in the women's sabre event at National Games in Gujarat on Friday. Tamil Nadu's Bhavani beat Punjab's Jagmeet Kaur 15-3 in the final. Bhavani had won gold medals in the 2011 and 2015 editions. After winning the gold, Bhavani said, "It feels great to complete my hattrick of gold medals."

283.title: Congress appoints Brijlal Khabri as party's UP state chief
283.article_body: Congress has named former BSP MP Brijlal Khabri as its new President for the party's Uttar Pradesh unit. After quitting BSP, Khabri joined Congress in 2016 and belongs to the Dalit community. The party has also appointed six regional heads namely Nasimuddin Siddiqui, Ajai Rai, Virendra Chaudhary, Nakul Dubey, Anil Yadav and Yogesh Dixit to the Uttar Pradesh Congress Committee.

284.title: Pictures show new circus-themed house with private jacuzzi for Bigg Boss 16
284.article_body: The interiors of the new Bigg Boss 16 house have been unveiled. Designed by Omung Kumar and his wife Vanitha, the house is designed as a circus and features an entrance with a joker's face, a carousel as a dining table and a captain's room with a personal jacuzzi. The bedrooms are divided into four sections, each with a theme.

285.title: Ajay Devgn's 'Maidaan' to release in February 2023
285.article_body: Ajay Devgn's 'Maidaan' is all set to release on February 17, 2023. The film, also starring Priyamani and Gajraj Rao, will be released in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam. 'Maidaan' is directed by Amit Ravindernath Sharma, who has also helmed 'Badhaai Ho' and 'Tevar'. Ajay will be seen playing the role of football coach Syed Abdul Rahim in the film.

286.title: Video of people dancing to Naatu Naatu in LA theatre surfaces, fans react
286.article_body: SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' was recently screened at Chinese Theatre in Los Angeles as a part of Beyond Fest. A video showing a few people dancing to 'Naatu Naatu' close to the screen has also surfaced online. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "Foreigners dancing...Thank you SSR," while another tweeted, "Running to...front & dancing is common...in India, it's happening there also."

287.title: Cuban capital sees protests for second night over power outage
287.article_body: Cuba's capital Havana reportedly witnessed protests for a second night late on Friday over continued blackouts in several neighbourhoods following Hurricane Ian that hit Cuba earlier this week. At one such protest, protesters chanted "turn on the lights" and raised anti-government slogans, Reuters reported. On Friday, officials said power had been restored to more than 60% of consumers in Havana.

288.title: Ajay shares pic with Suriya, says 'Deeply respect his talent & love his movies'
288.article_body: Ajay Devgn took to his social media handles to share a picture with Suriya from the 68th National Film Awards ceremony, which was held at Vigyan Bhawan in New Delhi on Friday. "It was fantastic to share time with my esteemed colleague & fellow best actor award winner, @Suriya_offl. Deeply respect his talent & love his movies," Ajay wrote.

289.title: Suryakumar is one of the best T20 batters currently: SA all-rounder Parnell
289.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa second T20I, South Africa all-rounder Wayne Parnell said India's Suryakumar is probably one of the best T20 batters at the moment. "He scores 360, which is very difficult for bowlers to try and defend...He's certainly playing really good cricket," he added. Suryakumar smashed an unbeaten 50 off 33 balls in the first T20I.

290.title: BJP to hold protest against Bihar's law & order situation: Sushil Modi
290.article_body: The BJP will observe a 15-minute silent protest in Patna on Sunday against the "deteriorating law and order situation" in Bihar. The decision came following an attack on BJP leader Bablu Singh, who was shot at by the assailants in Arrah. He further alleged that people in Bihar are afraid that "Lalu Raj" has returned to the state.

291.title: Technology has become democratic in its truest sense: PM after 5G launch
291.article_body: PM Narendra Modi praised the country's Digital India campaign while launching 5G services and said that technology has become democratic in its truest sense since even the poor of the country are adopting new technologies. "Digital India is not just a name, it is a big vision for the country's development," said the PM.

292.title: Myanmar accuses rebel forces of shooting a plane with 63 passengers
292.article_body: Myanmar's military government has accused rebel forces of firing at a plane carrying 63 passengers as it was preparing to land in Loikaw on Friday. One person was reportedly injured after being hit by a bullet that penetrated the fuselage. "This kind of attack...is a war crime...People, organisations who want peace need to condemn this issue," a military spokesman said.

293.title: 10-year-old boy sexually assaulted by 3 boys aged 10-12 years in Delhi, dies
293.article_body: A 10-year-old boy, who was allegedly beaten and sexually assaulted by three minor boys aged between 10 and 12 years, passed away in a hospital in Delhi on Saturday, police said. The victim and alleged culprits are from Delhi's Seelampur area and the incident was reported on September 18. The boy was allegedly assaulted over a debt his family owed.

294.title: Nicaragua cuts diplomatic ties with Netherlands
294.article_body: Nicaragua severed all diplomatic ties with the Netherlands on Friday. The government took the decision because the "interventionist and neo-colonial" European country had "offended and keeps offending Nicaraguan families", Nicaragua's Foreign Ministry said. Earlier, Nicaraguan President Daniel Ortega lashed out at the Netherlands after it said it wouldn't be funding a hospital promised long ago.

295.title: NTPC records 15.1% growth in power generation during Apr-Sept
295.article_body: State-run NTPC Limited recorded a 15.1% growth in power generation at 203.5 billion units (BU) during April-September 2022 from 176.8 BU in April to September 2021. NTPC Rihand in Uttar Pradesh was the top-performing thermal power plant with a 90.22% Plant Load Factor (PLF) during April-September 2022. NTPC coal stations' overall PLF stood at 76.3% in the said period.

296.title: Indian men's team wins 1st match, women's team loses at World Team TT C'ships
296.article_body: Indian men's team beat Uzbekistan 3-0 in their first group stage match at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in China on Saturday. Harmeet Desai, Sathiyan Gnanasekaran and Manav Thakkar won their respective matches to secure the tie. India will face Germany in their second match. Meanwhile, Indian women's team lost to Germany 2-3 in their first group stage match.

297.title: Central Railway collects ₹13.62 lakh fine in Mumbai's ticket checking drive
297.article_body: The Central Railway's Mumbai Division collected ₹13.62 lakh as fine during a one-day special ticket checking drive. The drive was conducted at 11 stations, including Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, Dadar, Ghatkopar, Thane, Dombivali and Kalyan, on September 29, reports said. Reports added that 4,732 cases of irregular or unauthorised travel were detected during the check.

298.title: Youth's body found in washroom of a PG in Bengaluru after 3 days
298.article_body: The body of a man was found in the bathroom of a PG facility in Bengaluru's Govindarajanagar, nearly three days after he died. The deceased, HS Anil Kumar (24), worked as a writer at a private firm, police said. Kumar had allegedly locked the bathroom from the inside and there are no signs of physical injuries on his body.

299.title: Karnataka teacher stripped, thrashed for sexually harassing girl
299.article_body: A school teacher was stripped, dragged and thrashed by villagers for allegedly sexually harassing a girl student in Karnataka's Davanagere district on Saturday. The parents and relatives of the girl, and the villagers barged into the school and confronted the teacher, identified as Lokesh Hodigere, after learning that he harassed her after the classes.

300.title: BMC collects ₹692 cr as property tax in first six months of 2022
300.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has collected ₹692 crore as property tax in the first six months of the current financial year. The civic body has set a target of ₹7,000 crore for the financial year 2022-2023, a civic official said. "We will soon conduct an auction of the seized properties from the defaulters," said Sunil Dhamne, BMC's joint commissioner.

301.title: Couple in Brazil dye waterfall near drought-hit town for gender reveal party; probe on
301.article_body: The environment ministry in Brazil is investigating a couple after they posted a video wherein they dyed a waterfall blue for their baby's gender reveal party, leading to possible contamination of water supply of a nearby town. The Queima-Pé waterfall is the main source of water for Tangara da Serra, a town that recently suffered a long period of drought.

302.title: Never thought India would become a manufacturing hub: Sunil Mittal
302.article_body: Bharti Airtel Chairman Sunil Bharti Mittal lauded PM Narendra Modi for his initiatives such as Digital India, Make in India and Startup India and said, "I never believed manufacturing would happen in India in my lifetime, especially in electronics". He further said that it has become a reality today that India is on course to becoming a manufacturing country.

303.title: You have glasses at this age!: PM Modi to school student at 5G launch
303.article_body: PM Narendra Modi virtually interacted with students during the 5G launch event in Delhi. While talking to a girl student of Ahmedabad's Ropda Primary School, the PM said, "You have glasses at this age! You must be very studious." He further asked her what subject would she like to study with the help of technology, to which she replied, "Science."

304.title: 2 snatch gold chain during 'Kalash Shobha Yatra' in Delhi; held
304.article_body: A woman and her daughter-in-law were arrested for allegedly snatching a woman's gold chain during the 'Kalash Shobha Yatra' in Delhi. The duo was caught after the 55-year-old woman, who is a registered criminal, was identified on CCTV footage. The police are looking for the woman's daughter who is also involved, a senior police officer said.

305.title: Man tries to kiss cobra after rescuing it in Karnataka, gets bitten; video surfaces
305.article_body: A video shows a man from Karnataka trying to kiss a cobra he had just rescued. However, the snake turned its head back and bit him on the lip. The incident happened at Bommanakatte in Bhadravathi of Shivamogga district. The snake slipped away from his hands and other people can be seen trying to catch it as it slithered away.

306.title: Mehbooba Mufti seeks ailing separatist leader Altaf Shah's release
306.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti has urged the Union Home Ministry to release ailing separatist leader Altaf Shah, son-in-law of Hurriyat Conference ex-chief Syed Ali Geelani, on humanitarian grounds. Ruwa Shah, Altaf's daughter, said her father has been diagnosed with acute renal cancer and urged the government to consider shifting to a private hospital for treatment.

307.title: FIR against Cong worker for displaying PayCM poster during 'padyatra'
307.article_body: The Karnataka police have lodged an FIR against a Congress worker, Akshay Kumar, for displaying PayCM poster during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. He was also seen wearing a t-shirt with PayCM poster besides carrying a flag. Gundlupet town municipality member Kiran Gowda alleged that the Congress worker had insulted Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai.

308.title: Russia accused of 'kidnapping' head of Europe's largest nuclear plant
308.article_body: Ukrainian state nuclear company Energoatom has accused Russia of kidnapping the head of Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. Ihor Murashov was reportedly driving from the Zaporizhzhia plant to a nearby town on Friday afternoon when he was stopped, blindfolded and taken to an unknown location. "Ihor's detention...jeopardises the safety of...plant," Energoatom chief Petro Kotin said.

309.title: Woman drug peddler held in Hyderabad, 44 kg marijuana seized
309.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested a woman drug peddler, Laxmi Bai, from Mahatma Gandhi Bus Station on Friday and seized 44 kg marijuana worth ₹3.5 lakh. According to the police, the accused was transporting and supplying marijuana to customers in Maharashtra's Parbhani. Laxmi along with her accomplice, Rahul Kokate, visited Odisha's Malkangiri and procured 22 marijuana packets wrapped in brown tape.

310.title: Part of roof falls on cheering fans at football stadium in Chile, video surfaces
310.article_body: Several cheering fans were injured after a section of a roof at a football stadium crashed on them during a training session hosted by Chilean club Colo Colo on Friday. Videos of the incident also surfaced online. Meanwhile, Colo Colo said that a group of people climbed onto a structure for advertising causing part of the roof to collapse.

311.title: New Congress chief will be a 'puppet' of Gandhi family: Sushil Modi
311.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi has criticised the process of the Congress Presidential election, claiming that whoever is elected will be a "puppet" of the Gandhi family. Friday was the last day for filing nominations for the election of the Congress President, where a total of three leaders staked their claim for the post.

312.title: Dengue cases cross 20,000-mark in West Bengal in 2022
312.article_body: Dengue cases in West Bengal so far in 2022 have crossed the 20,000-mark. This comes after 924 new confirmed cases were detected in the state on Friday. As many as 4,744 fresh cases were recorded in the past week. The state Health Department has asked its staff not to leave their places of posting without prior notice.

313.title: Hrithik's Vedha is a lion, tiger & panther all rolled into one: Johar
313.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar took to Twitter and praised Hrithik Roshan's performance in his recent film 'Vikram Vedha'. He said that Hrithik is "the ultimate leading man of the mainstream movies". "Hrithik Roshan is a force of nature...from his sinister smile to his solid swag...His VEDHA is a lion, tiger and panther all rolled into one!!! WOW," Johar further wrote.

314.title: Water stock in lakes sufficient, no water cuts till next monsoon: BMC
314.article_body: Since the water stock in lakes is sufficient, there will be no water cuts till next monsoon in Mumbai, according to BMC officials. On Friday, the seven lakes that supply water to the city were 98.50% full. In 2018, when rainfall was below average, lakes had 91% stock and the city faced a 10% water cut from November to June.

315.title: Many made fun of my vision of Aatmanirbhar Bharat: PM at 5G launch
315.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing people during the launch of 5G technology, said the low cost of devices can only be achieved through Aatmanirbhar Bharat. Adding that "many people made fun" of his vision of Aatmanirbhar Bharat, he further said that today, number of phone manufacturing units in India is over 200 while in 2014, there were only two units.

316.title: Govt employee poses as judge before AAP leader in Punjab, 2 arrested
316.article_body: A Punjab government employee who allegedly posed as a judge before an AAP leader has been arrested, police said. A total of three government employees were booked in the case, among whom one was arrested on Wednesday, police added. The accused, over a call, had congratulated the AAP leader for his elevation as joint secretary of the AAP's SC wing.

317.title: Thousands of Russian troops in Lyman surrounded: Ukraine
317.article_body: Thousands of Russian troops in the town of Lyman have been surrounded by Ukrainian forces in an ongoing operation, Ukraine's military said on Saturday. The town has served as a logistics and transport hub for Russian forces operating in the northern Donetsk region. "Lyman is important because it is the next step towards the liberation of...Donbas," the military added.

318.title: UPI transactions rise by over 3% at 678 crore in September: NPCI
318.article_body: UPI transactions surged by over 3% in September from that in August, the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) data showed. In value terms, 678 crore transactions in the last month translate to transactions worth ₹11.16 lakh crore, up from ₹10.73 lakh crore in August. In July, India processed 628 crore UPI transactions worth ₹10.62 lakh crore.

319.title: No petrol, diesel in Delhi without PUC from Oct 25: Environment minister
319.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai said no petrol and diesel will be provided without a PUC (pollution under control) certificate of the vehicle at petrol pumps from October 25. "Vehicular emission is one of the key contributors to rising pollution in Delhi," he added. Delhi government will launch its 24x7 war room on October 3 to combat pollution, Rai stated.

320.title: KN Tripathi's nomination form for Congress President poll rejected
320.article_body: Former Jharkhand minister KN Tripathi's nomination form for Congress President election has been rejected, Congress' Central Election Authority chief Madhusudan Mistry said on Saturday. His form did not meet the norms and had signature-related issues, he added. Mistry further revealed that Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor are currently the only contenders for the post of Congress President.

321.title: Woman stabs brother-in-law to death during a quarrel in Thane
321.article_body: A woman allegedly stabbed her brother-in-law to death during a quarrel in the Mafatlal slum colony in Kalwa, Thane. The accused, Priyanka Survade (23), used to live with her husband and the family of the deceased, Sagar Survade, in the same residence, police said. Sagar was allegedly an alcoholic and used to fight with his wife, police added.

322.title: Ebola kills doctor in Uganda, 1st health worker killed in latest outbreak
322.article_body: A 37-year-old Tanzanian doctor working in Uganda has died after contracting Ebola, Uganda's Health Minister Jane Aceng said on Saturday. Mohammed Ali, who had tested positive for Ebola on September 26, is the first health worker to be killed by the disease in the latest outbreak in the country. Ugandan authorities announced the outbreak of hemorrhagic fever on September 20.

323.title: Meta to continue paying for ex-COO Sandberg's personal security after her exit
323.article_body: Meta will provide personal security services to former COO Sheryl Sandberg even after her departure over "continuing threats to her safety". Meta expects to continue to pay for security services at Sandberg's residences and during her personal travel till June 30 next year. Sandberg, who had joined the company in 2008, marked her last day at Meta on September 30.

324.title: Activision Chief Compliance Officer Frances Townsend steps down
324.article_body: Activision Blizzard's Chief Compliance Officer Frances Townsend has stepped down from her role after nearly two years. She will now work as an advisor to the video game company's board and its CEO Bobby Kotick. Townsend was criticised last year for calling claims mentioned in a lawsuit against alleged sexism at Activision "factually incorrect, old and out of context".

325.title: Delhi govt collects ₹768 cr from excise duty, VAT, licence fee in 30 days
325.article_body: The Delhi government has collected ₹768 crore excise revenue in 30 days. This revenue has been collected from excise duty, VAT and licence fee under the current excise regime. The excise department official said the ₹768 crore figure includes about ₹460 crore from excise duty, ₹140 crore from VAT and revenue from the licence fee.

326.title: Raja Singh's supporters offer prayers at Hyd temple for his release
326.article_body: Around 50 supporters of suspended BJP MLA Raja Singh offered prayers for his release at the Bhagyalaxmi temple near Charminar in Hyderabad on Friday. They participated in 'maha aarti' and raised slogans like "Raja bhai tum sangharsh karo hum tumhare saath hai" (you fight, we are with you). The Goshamahal MLA is in jail for his remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

327.title: Cyber awareness workshop for women and children conducted in Noida
327.article_body: A cyber awareness workshop was conducted at the Gautam Buddha Nagar Police Commissionerate on Friday. It was attended by over 350 participants, including 194 students and several women police personnel. The participants were informed about ways to keep their personal information safe from cyber frauds. "The attendees were informed about the helpline number," said an official.

328.title: 5 people rescued after fire breaks out at call centre in Noida
328.article_body: A fire broke out at a call centre in Noida Sector 3 on Friday morning, however, no one was injured in the incident. Five people who were trapped on the second floor of the call centre were rescued using hydraulic ladders, fire department officials said. Four fire tenders were rushed to the spot after the incident was reported, officials added.

329.title: Tharoor to start campaign for Cong Presidential polls from Nagpur today
329.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor will start his campaign for the party President's election by visiting the Deekshabhoomi monument in Nagpur today, where he will pay his tribute to Dr Ambedkar and later address a press conference. On Sunday, he will visit Mahatma Gandhi's Sevagram Ashram in Wardha at 9 am. He will hold meetings with senior party leaders and workers.

330.title: Salman shares pic with body double after he dies, says 'Thank you for being there with me'
330.article_body: Actor Salman Khan took to social media to share a photo with his body double Sagar Pandey following his demise. "I thank you from the bottom of my heart for being there with me. May your soul rest in peace brother Sagar. Thank you, RIP Sagar Pandey," he wrote. Sagar passed away on Friday due to a heart attack.

331.title: GST collections cross ₹1.4 lakh cr for 7th straight month, up 26% in Sept
331.article_body: The gross GST revenue collection in September surged by 26% to ₹1,47,686 crore, Finance Ministry said. This is the seventh month in a row that the monthly GST revenues have crossed the ₹1.4 lakh crore mark. Total revenue of the Centre and states after regular settlements in September 2022 stood at ₹57,151 crore for CGST and ₹59,216 crore for SGST.

332.title: Varanasi university removes guest lecturer over FB post on Navratri
332.article_body: Varanasi-based Mahatma Gandhi Kashi Vidyapith (MGKV) dismissed a guest lecturer over his Facebook post on Navratri. "Instead of fasting for nine days during Navratri, it will be better for women to read the Indian Constitution and Hindu Code Bill," Mithilesh Kumar Gautam had written on Facebook. He has also been barred from entering the university campus.

333.title: Allahabad High Court stays arrest of SP leader Azam Khan, son
333.article_body: Allahabad High Court on Friday stayed Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Azam Khan and his son Abdullah Azam Khan's arrest in connection with a 2017 case involving the recovery of some Rampur civic body machines from the Mohammad Ali Jauhar University campus. Police had earlier lodged an FIR against Khan, his son and four others in the case.

334.title: He's right: Clooney on Pitt calling him 'most handsome man in the world'
334.article_body: Actor George Clooney in an interview was asked what he thought about Brad Pitt recently calling him the most handsome man in the world. The 61-year-old actor said, "Well, he's right about that. Let's face it. He's right." Pitt and Clooney have worked together in several films, including 'Ocean's Eleven', 'Ocean's Twelve' and 'Burn After Reading'.

335.title: Telecom industry is foundation of Digital India: Ashwini Vaishnaw
335.article_body: Union Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw called the telecom industry a sunrise industry and said, "Telecom is the gateway, the foundation of Digital India. It is the mode to bring digital services to every person." For last mile connectivity, a sum of ₹35,000 crore has been sanctioned that will take 5G to every nook and corner of the country, he added.

336.title: Stop and smell the roses: Elon Musk on advice to younger self
336.article_body: Elon Musk was asked during Tesla's 'AI Day' event that what advice he'd give to his younger self. Replying, the 51-year-old said, "I'd say to twenty- or twenty-something me, 'just stop and smell the roses occasionally'." Recalling the time he was developing an early SpaceX rocket on an island, he said, "I should have had a drink on the beach!"

337.title: Govt job mindset impediment to startup culture: Jitendra Singh
337.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh said that the government job mindset is proving to be an impediment to the startup culture. He said that the startup culture is yet to fully catch up to the imagination of entrepreneurs in some north Indian states as against those down south, which have taken a lead by engaging a chain of globally recognised startups.

338.title: Ghaziabad man kills wife, 15-yr-old daughter after dispute over water supply
338.article_body: A 42-year-old man allegedly killed his 36-year-old wife and 15-year-old daughter after a fight in Ghaziabad. Reports said that the couple used to fight a lot. Before the murder, they had fought after the wife had shut off water supply. "The wife was found dead in her room while [the daughter's] body was found on the terrace," police said.

339.title: Ex-Trump aide jailed after admitting possession of child sexual abuse images
339.article_body: Adam Hageman, an official who worked in US Commerce Department during ex-President Donald Trump's administration, has been jailed for five-and-a-half years after pleading guilty to possession of child sexual abuse images. He was arrested in November 2020. Hageman was accused of "sharing a child pornography video and commenting several times on sexually abusing children" in an online group chat.

340.title: Marvel and DC director James Gunn marries actress Jennifer Holland, shares pics
340.article_body: Marvel and DC director James Gunn got married to his longtime girlfriend, actress Jennifer Holland in Aspen, Colorado. Sharing photos from the wedding, he wrote, "After over 7 years together, I finally married the love of my life." "What an incredible, beautiful, stunning day surrounded by the most wonderful family and friends in the world," James added.

341.title: Bella Hadid gets dress spray-painted on her body live on runway, video surfaces
341.article_body: At a fashion show in Paris, a dress was spray-painted on model Bella Hadid’s body in front of the audience from start to finish. A video of it also showed how a woman cut a slit in the dress, following which Hadid walked the runway. The dress was made of Fabrican, a spray-on material that hardens into a wearable textile.

342.title: Caught drunk driving, man removes clothes before police in Hyderabad
342.article_body: A man reportedly removed his clothes before the police after he was caught for drunk driving in Hyderabad's Malakpet area on Friday. Initially, the man tried to escape checking but after getting caught, he got into an argument with the police. He alleged that he resorted to the act of undressing himself as the police had abused him.

343.title: Punjab man kills self after lover slaps him for asking to return money
343.article_body: A 30-year-old man died by suicide by consuming poison after his lover refused to return the money he had given to her in Punjab's Ludhiana. The lover also grabbed him by his collar and slapped him. The deceased's father said that his son cried after that and said that he felt insulted and would die.

344.title: Bihar doctor held for making liquor from medicines escapes Excise Dept custody
344.article_body: A doctor who had been arrested for allegedly making liquor from medicines in Bihar escaped the Excise Department's custody, reports said. He was arrested when the Excise Department officials found a stock of medicines that he was using to make liquor. An official said that the accused was sitting at the police station with tied hands but managed to escape.

345.title: Nitish Kumar focused on uniting the Opposition: Tejashwi Yadav
345.article_body: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav has put an end to speculations about Chief Minister Nitish Kumar contesting Lok Sabha polls in 2024, saying that Kumar is focused on uniting the Opposition. "He (CM Nitish Kumar) is the CM and we're working under his guidance...He has no desire to become the Prime Minister," said Tejashwi.

346.title: 10-year-old boy dies weeks after 3 friends sodomise him in Delhi
346.article_body: A 10-year-old boy died after he was sodomised on September 18 by three of his friends, aged 10-12 years, in Delhi's Seelampur area, police said on Saturday. The victim was admitted to Lok Nayak Hospital on September 22. "The boy passed away owing to complications from his injuries. Two accused boys (have been) apprehended," Delhi Police said.

347.title: I used to survived on a biscuit, walked 7 km to give auditions: Actor Darshan
347.article_body: Actor Darshan Kumaar said that he used to survive on a biscuit and walked for around seven kilometres to give auditions. "I used to carry an extra t-shirt and deodorant to give multiple auditions. Those were the days when I learned a lot. I used to do dubbing to run my livelihood," he added.

348.title: Minor boy who was sodomised by 3 friends dies in Delhi hospital
348.article_body: A minor boy who was allegedly assaulted and sodomised by his three minor friends died at a hospital in Delhi on Saturday, police said. The victim and the friends are all aged between 10 to 12. Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal also confirmed the news in a tweet which said that the boy's killers "must be punished severely".

349.title: World Bank to provide $530 mn additional aid to Ukraine amid war
349.article_body: The World Bank said it'll provide an additional $530 million to help Ukraine meet urgent needs created by Russia's invasion of the country. The aid is supported by the UK ($500 million) and Denmark ($30 million), it added. World Bank has mobilised nearly $13 billion in emergency financing for Ukraine to date, of which $11 billion has been fully disbursed.

350.title: 5G like 'Digital Kamdhenu', heavenly cow that grants whatever we desire: Ambani
350.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani compared 5G technology to a "Digital Kamdhenu" and said, "It will not be an exaggeration to say that 5G is...the heavenly cow that grants whatever we desire." He added, "The rollout of 5G in India is not an ordinary event in India's telecom history. It carries...keen expectations and...high aspirations of 1.4 billion Indians."

351.title: Video shows PM Modi getting 5G demo from Jio Chairman Akash Ambani
351.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was provided with a demonstration of 'True 5G' devices by Reliance Jio’s Chairman Akash Ambani on Saturday at India Mobile Congress.
