Accompanied by Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani, PM Modi was seen trying the 'Jio Glass' with Akash Ambani assisting him.

352.title: Indian startup market behind China's but has potential: Facebook Co-founder
352.article_body: Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin said that even though the Indian startup market is still behind China's in areas such as ease of asset exits and market liquidity, it has "tremendous potential". He further said that with a better macroeconomic environment and a more mature market, the Indian startups market would be one "to bet on, combined with Southeast Asia".

353.title: Woman sexually abused, cheated of ₹66 lakh in Pune; 2 arrested
353.article_body: Pune police arrested two persons after a woman was allegedly cheated of ₹66 lakh on pretext of buying land and was sexually abused over the period between July 2021 and January 2022. According to investigators, one of the accused apparently sexually exploited the woman on multiple occasions and threatened to kill her. The woman had lodged an FIR on Thursday.

354.title: HDFC Ltd hikes lending rate by 50 bps, EMIs to go up
354.article_body: Mortgage lender HDFC Limited increased its lending rate by 50 basis points on Friday after the Reserve Bank of India hiked the benchmark interest rate. The new rate comes into effect on October 1 and the home loan EMIs of lender's customers will also increase. This is the seventh time HDFC has hiked the rate in the last five months.

355.title: 3 car passengers killed as apple-laden truck overturns on it in Shimla
355.article_body: At least three passengers of a car were killed after an apple-laden truck overturned on it in Shimla's Chharabra in Himachal Pradesh on Saturday morning. The driver of the truck suffered minor injuries and has been arrested. Himachal CM Jairam Thakur expressed his condolences and tweeted, "May God give peace to the departed souls and strength to the bereaved families."

356.title: Pak govt's Twitter account withheld in India due to 'legal demand'
356.article_body: The official Twitter account of the Pakistani government was withheld on Saturday with the social media company saying that the move came in response to a legal demand by the Centre. It is yet to be ascertained as to what prompted the move against their official Twitter handle. The account was withheld earlier in July also but was later reactivated.

357.title: I am not in a hurry to become CM: Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi Yadav
357.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav reacted to RJD leader Jagadanand Singh's claim that the former would become state CM in 2023, saying, "I have no personal ambition nor am I in a hurry." He also advised RJD leaders to not speak on the matter. "We must remain focused on dislodging from power fascist forces represented by the BJP," he added.

358.title: 3rd party loan recovery agents should be on right side of law: RBI
358.article_body: Clarifying that the RBI is not against the outsourcing of recovery activities by banks, RBI Deputy Governor MK Jain said, "It should be on the right side of the law". He was referring to the incident of a pregnant woman being allegedly crushed to death under a tractor that was being taken away by Mahindra Finance's recovery agents in Jharkhand.

359.title: We may have started late, but will finish first: Mukesh Ambani on 5G in India
359.article_body: Asia's second-richest person Mukesh Ambani, speaking at the launch event of 5G technology services in the country, said, "India may have started late, but...we will finish first" by rolling out 5G across the nation. He said that 5G will help India achieve the goal of $40-trillion economy by 2047 and help increase per capita income from $2,000 to $20,000.

360.title: Putin's latest actions most serious escalation since war began: NATO
360.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg has accused Russian President Vladimir Putin of provoking "the most serious escalation" of the war in Ukraine since it began in February. "We've the combination of the mobilisation in Russia, combined with the...dangerous nuclear rhetoric, and then...illegal annexation," Stoltenberg said. The escalation will not deter NATO from supporting Ukraine, he added.

361.title: Suvendu accuses Mamata-led WB govt of 'illegally diverting funds'
361.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari has written a letter to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in which he accused state CM Mamata Banerjee-led government of illegally diverting funds provided by the Centre. Adhikari claimed that a major portion of the funds was transferred to the State Emergency Relief Fund which is controlled by the CM's Office.

362.title: PM Modi drives car in Europe remotely from India using 5G, video surfaces
362.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday conducted test drive of a car in Europe remotely from India using 5G technology at the India Mobile Congress 2022. He drove the remote controlled car, which was set up to navigate a closed indoor course in Sweden. Sharing a picture of PM conducting the test, Union Minister Piyush Goyal tweeted, "India driving the world."

363.title: Nord Stream leaks likely single largest methane release ever: UN
363.article_body: The UN Environment Programme said the ruptures on the Nord Stream natural gas pipeline system under the Baltic Sea have led to what's "likely the largest emission" of climate-damaging methane ever recorded. According to environmental data company GHGSat, the leak rate from one of four rupture points was 22,920 kg/h, equivalent to burning about 2,86,000 kg of coal every hour.

364.title: Gurugram may host some G20 meetings in 2023: Official
364.article_body: A team from the Ministry of External Affairs held a meeting with local officers in Gurugram on Friday. The city is likely to host a few G20 meetings after India assumes the Presidency of the group on December 1st this year. "Four to five meetings are likely to be held in the city, involving 300-400 foreign delegates," an official said.

365.title: 5 RSS leaders in Kerala get Y security over threat from PFI: Report
365.article_body: Five RSS leaders in Kerala have been given Y security cover by the central government over suspected threats from banned organisation PFI, reported PTI quoting sources. The CRPF's VIP security wing has been put up to the task. The leaders are believed to be targets of PFI as per documents recovered by central investigative agencies during recent raids.

366.title: Priyanka Chopra interviews US VP Harris, discusses mansplaining, abortion rights
366.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra on Friday interviewed the US Vice President Kamala Harris at the women's leadership forum organised by the Democratic National Committee in Washington. Chopra and Harris discussed various topics including mansplaining, reproductive rights and gun laws. Pointing to the silence in the room, Chopra joked, "Do you hear that sound? That is the sound of no mansplaining, ladies."

367.title: Man kills 8-year-old grandniece for refusing to bring tobacco in MP
367.article_body: A 60-year-old man allegedly killed his eight-year-old grandniece with an axe and buried her body in a heap of fodder in Madhya Pradesh's Guna, a police official said on Friday. The incident occurred after the grandniece "refused to bring tobacco from a nearby shop despite repeated requests", the SP said. The accused has been arrested, the SP added.

368.title: Mallikarjun Kharge resigns as Rajya Sabha Leader of Opposition
368.article_body: In line with Congress' resolution of 'one person, one post', senior leader Mallikarjun Kharge resigned as the Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha after filing nomination for his party's President post. He submitted his resignation to party chief Sonia Gandhi. As the head of the Congress parliamentary party, Gandhi will have to appoint a new Leader of Opposition.

369.title: Ex-Maharashtra minister allegedly threatens to kill man; FIR filed
369.article_body: An FIR has been filed after former Maharashtra minister and NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal and two others allegedly threatened to kill a man, an official said. The man said that he was threatened for "forwarding two videos to Bhujbal, in which the latter allegedly spoke against Hindu religion", an official said. Bhujbal is currently the MLA for Yeola.

370.title: Which 13 Indian cities will first get the newly-launched 5G services?
370.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday launched 5G services in selected cities in India. While the service will be available to the entire country in a couple of years, the network will be launched in 13 Indian cities first. The cities are, namely, Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chandigarh, Chennai, Delhi, Gandhinagar, Gurugram, Hyderabad, Jamnagar, Kolkata, Lucknow, Mumbai and Pune.

371.title: Pune Police busts call centre of instant loan apps, 18 arrested
371.article_body: Pune Police busted a call centre of instant loan apps and arrested 18 persons for issuing threats and harassing defaulters. Police received 4,778 complaints from 2020 to 2022 in which people claimed they were abused and harassed, Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta said. "These apps seek access to the camera, photos, contacts and storage on mobile phones," Gupta added.

372.title: Woman touches feet of Arun Govil who played Lord Ram in Ramayan, video surfaces
372.article_body: A woman was seen touching the feet of actor Arun Govil, who played Lord Ram in the television serial 'Ramayan'. She was seen bowing down in front of him at the Mumbai Airport while the actor stood with folded hands. A video of the incident has surfaced online. The woman also got pictures clicked with the actor.

373.title: Parag is trying to please people: Musk to Dorsey after offering to buy Twitter
373.article_body: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk offered to acquire Twitter, a text conversation between him and Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey surfaced. Musk wrote to Dorsey, "Parag is just moving far too slowly and trying to please people who will not be happy no matter what he does." Dorsey replied, "At least it became clear that you can't work together."

374.title: mCaffeine announces Buy 1 Get 1 Sale & free iPhones on its 6th birthday
374.article_body: Natural & 100% vegan brand mCaffeine has announced its Buy 1 Get 1 Sale to celebrate its 6th birthday. With offers as big as BOGO days, chances to win big prizes like iPhone 14 every day and a sponsored trip to Goa, the brand is going bigger than ever, it shared, adding that the sale goes live for 6 days.

375.title: Cong only party in country that elects its President: Jairam Ramesh
375.article_body: Former Union Minister Jairam Ramesh praised the Congress and said that it's the only party in the country that elects its President. "The other parties do not have elections to this effect. Our party has a system. It makes no difference whether the elections are won by Rajya Sabha leader Mallikarjun Kharge or former Union Minister Shashi Tharoor," said Ramesh.

376.title: Burkina Faso's military leader ousted in second coup this year
376.article_body: A group of Burkina Faso army soldiers announced that the country's coup leader-turned-President, Lieutenant Colonel Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba, has been ousted. Captain Ibrahim Traore, the new leader of Burkina Faso, said that Damiba was removed due to his inability to deal with a worsening Islamist insurgency. Damiba had ousted former President Roch Kabore in January citing the same reason.

377.title: PM Narendra Modi launches 5G services in selected cities in India
377.article_body: PM Narendra Modi launched 5G services in selected cities at India Mobile Congress on Saturday. The service is expected to cover the entire country over the next couple of years. In August, the Centre received bids worth ₹1.50 lakh crore from the spectrum auction. Reliance Jio, Adani Group, Bharti Airtel, and Vodafone Idea were the four participants in the auction.

378.title: India's forex reserves record steepest weekly fall in 6 months
378.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell by $8.134 billion to $537.518 billion for the week ended September 23, the RBI data showed. This is the steepest weekly fall in six months and reserves have fallen for eight straight weeks now. This decline was due to a dip in the foreign currency assets which decreased by $7.688 billion to $477.212 billion.

379.title: Telangana hikes quota for STs to 10% in educational institutes, govt jobs
379.article_body: K Chandrashekar Rao-led Telangana government has hiked the reservation for Scheduled Tribes (STs) from 6% to 10% in educational institutes and state government services with effect from October 1. The overall quota in the state for various categories has now gone up to 54%. A bill on the 10% reservation was passed by the Telangana Assembly in April 2017.

380.title: India's core sectors grew 3.3% in August, lowest in 9 months
380.article_body: India's core sectors grew 3.3% in August, which is the lowest in nine months. It had grown 4.5% in July, while in August last year, it was 12.2%. Except for crude oil and natural gas, which contracted by 3.3% and 0.9%, respectively, all sectors including coal, refinery products, electricity, fertilisers, cement and steel posted growth.

381.title: Fiscal deficit widens to ₹5.42 lakh crore in April-August period
381.article_body: India's fiscal deficit for the April-August period of the current financial year touched ₹5.42 lakh crore or 32.6% of annual estimates, government data showed on Friday. In the year-ago period, the fiscal deficit had touched 31.1% of the annual estimates. Net tax receipts surged to about ₹7 lakh crore, while total expenditure was ₹13.9 lakh crore.

382.title: We condemn continued targeting of innocent students: India on Kabul terror attack
382.article_body: India has condemned the terror attack at Kaaj Educational Center in Kabul on Friday that killed at least 19 people and injured many others. "We are saddened by yesterday's terror attack...and extend our condolences to the families of the victims. India strongly condemns the continued targeting of innocent students at educational places," External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said.

383.title: Twitch to charge viewers $100 to pin chat messages for 2.5 minutes
383.article_body: Twitch is testing a paid feature called 'Elevated Chat' that will allow viewers to get their chat messages highlighted for a specific amount of time. The feature comes with five different pricing tiers, ranging from $5 for 30 seconds to $100 for 2.5 minutes. Twitch will give streamers a 70/30 cut of revenue from elevated chats after taxes and fees.

384.title: Pune police rescue 3 women after busting prostitution racket
384.article_body: Pune police rescued three women after busting a prostitution racket by laying a trap using decoy customers. A person who trafficked women was also arrested. A police inspector said that the modus operandi was that a person called the customers and sent them photos of women. Phone, cash and an autorickshaw worth a total of ₹62,500 were seized, officials said.

385.title: Centre extends AFSPA in several districts of Nagaland, Arunachal
385.article_body: The central government extended the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act or AFSPA in nine districts and 16 police stations in four other districts of Nagaland from October 1 to March 30, 2023. It also extended AFSPA in three districts of Arunachal Pradesh, including Tirap, Changlang and Longding, and areas falling within the jurisdiction of Namsai and Mahadevpur police stations.

386.title: Avalanche hits mountains surrounding Kedarnath temple, no damage to temple
386.article_body: An avalanche hit the Himalayan mountains surrounding the Kedarnath Temple, news agency ANI reported. Shri Badrinath-Kedarnath Temple Committee President, Ajendra Ajay, said that no damage was done to the Kedarnath temple due to the avalanche. ANI shared a video of the incident, showing the movement of snow during the avalanche at a faraway mountain.

387.title: I kinda don't think I should be the boss of anyone: Musk told Twitter CEO in a text
387.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk told Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal in a text message that he "kinda thinks" he shouldn't be the "boss of anyone". Musk told Agrawal, "Frankly, I hate doing mgmt stuff...But I love helping solve technical/product design problems." The texts were released as part of the ongoing documentation ahead of their trial starting October 17.

388.title: Girl who received 'condom' remark offered free supply of pads, funding for education
388.article_body: Bihar's Riya Kumari, who was told "next you will want free condoms" by an IAS officer, has been offered a year's worth of free sanitary pads. "A small token of...appreciation for her conviction to put an end to...bloody hypocrisy around menstruation," CEO of a Delhi-based company said. The company will also bear cost of her education fees through her graduation.

389.title: MP HC sees violent protests as lawyer kills self after pleading in court
389.article_body: Madhya Pradesh High Court witnessed violent protests by advocates as a lawyer allegedly died by suicide after pleading in the Jabalpur bench. Some policemen suffered injuries, Jabalpur SP said. The protesting lawyers allegedly vandalised courtrooms and set ablaze a senior advocate's office. This comes after the deceased allegedly had an altercation with a judge during a bail plea hearing.

390.title: 4 accused to be tried as adults in Hyderabad Jubilee Hills gangrape
390.article_body: Four of the five minors accused in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gangrape case will be tried as adults, said a Juvenile Justice Board on Friday. The accused had offered lift to a 17-year-old girl and then took turns raping her inside a car. The Principal Magistrate noted that the four minors were capable of understanding the consequences of their actions.

391.title: Gadkari asks Mercedes to produce affordable cars locally, says 'Even I can't afford them'
391.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari urged Mercedes-Benz to produce more cars locally and emphasised reducing costs. Speaking at the company's event, he said, "You increase the production, only then is it possible to reduce cost. We're middle-class people, even I can't afford your car." The company has launched EQS 580 4MATIC in India, its first locally assembled electric car.

392.title: 9 foreigners arrested as protests continue in Iran over Amini's death
392.article_body: Iran's Intelligence Ministry said on Friday that nine foreign nationals had been arrested in connection with the ongoing protests over the death of a 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini in police custody. The citizens from Germany, Poland, Italy, France, the Netherlands, Sweden and other countries were detained "during the riots or while plotting in the background", the ministry added.

393.title: Telangana CM KCR visits Yadadri temple, offers gold worth ₹52 lakh
393.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Friday visited the Sri Lakshminarasimha Swamy Temple in Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district along with his family members. On Rao's behalf, his grandson offered a cheque of over ₹52 lakh to the temple as a donation for buying 1.16 kg of gold. The gold will be used for gold plating the "gopuram" at the temple.

394.title: Massive fire breaks out at Gurugram's Global Foyer Mall, several fire tenders rushed
394.article_body: A massive fire broke out at the Global Foyer Mall situated on the Golf Course Road in Gurugram on Saturday morning. The fire reportedly broke out on the first floor of the mall. Several fire tenders were rushed to the site and officials said that the fire has been brought under control. No casualties were reported in the incident.

395.title: North Korea fires 4th round of missile tests in 1 week
395.article_body: North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles on Saturday, marking the fourth round of such a test in a week. South Korean military said it spotted the launches 18 minutes apart. Notably, amid North Korea's missile tests, the navies of South Korea, the US and Japan staged trilateral anti-submarine exercises on Friday for the first time in five years.

396.title: Introducing India’s first ever investment festival: ET Money
396.article_body: ET Money has launched the Great Indian Investment Festival that promises rewards worth ₹20 lakh for tax savings and investments. Users can get flat 60% off on Genius membership, up to ₹2 lakh of referral rewards and assured Amazon vouchers. Lucky draw winners will also get iPhone 14 Plus, iPad Air 5 and Royal Enfield Interceptor, said the brand.

397.title: Musk unveils prototype of Tesla's humanoid robot, to cost less than a car
397.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk unveiled a prototype of humanoid robot, dubbed 'Optimus', during the company's AI Day event on Saturday. During the event, the robot walked onstage, waved hello and danced. "The robot can actually do a lot more...We just didn't want it to fall on its face," said Musk, adding that it's expected to cost less than a car.

398.title: 6-year-old beaten to death for eating apple from 'prasad' in Bihar
398.article_body: A six-year-old boy was allegedly beaten to death for eating an apple from 'prasad' or offering meant for Goddess Durga at a school in Bihar's Gaya. "The owners of the school kept Vivek in a room and brutally assaulted him. After the physical assault, they threw him outside the premises," said the victim's grandfather. Police have arrested the accused.

399.title: Robinhood to close 5 more offices in US, no worker to be laid off
399.article_body: Robinhood Markets on Friday said it will partially or completely shut down five more offices in the US as part of its restructuring plan to cut expenses. The California-based brokerage company said the closures, which will result in restructuring charges of around $45 million, will be done without any job cuts. Robinhood fired around 23% of its employees in August.

400.title: No direct trains from Noida Electronic City to Dwarka Sec 21 on Sunday till 2 pm: DMRC
400.article_body: No direct Metro trains will be available from Noida Electronic City to Dwarka/Dwarka Sector-21 on Sunday till 2 PM due to track maintenance work between Yamuna Bank and Akshardham stations, DMRC said. "Train services...will be operated in two loops- regular services from Dwarka Sector-21 to Yamuna Bank in one loop...Yamuna Bank to Noida Electronic City in another loop," DMRC added.
